		<div class="row content recessed-content">
			<div class="wrap clearfix">
			                        <img class="scale-with-grid float-right" src="./images/headers/05.jpg" alt="Banner Image" />            <div class="column9  main-content" id="content">
				  <div class="content-container">
                    <div class="box" style="border: thin solid #CCC; width:560px; padding: .5em; margin-left:auto; margin-right:auto;">
						<iframe width="560" height="315" src="//www.sms.cam.ac.uk/media/2120347/embed" frameborder="0" scrolling="no" allowfullscreen></iframe><br /> 
       					<h3 class="centred">Cambridge Open Days</h3>                  
</div>
                    <p>&nbsp;</p>                   
                      <h2 class="centred"><strong>Visit Us</strong></h2>

                      <p>The best time to visit the Cambridge English Faculty is on one of our annual open days, which are held in early July, and we invite you to come and meet us on one of these occasions. The Faculty and its Library will be open for you to have a look around, and there will be lecturers available on the information stand all day to answer your questions. We also put on sample lectures, student-led tours, and a course information presentation.                      </p>
                      <p>For more information and to book places on the open days, please visit our <u><a href="http://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/events/cambridge-open-days">Open Days page.</a></u>                      </p>
                      <p>You can also attend our subject-specific Masterclasses, which provide you with a taste of undergraduate teaching as well as an opportunity to learn more about our degree course and admissions.                       </p>
                      <p>For more information on these taster days, please visit the <u><a href="http://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/events/masterclasses">Subject Masterclasses page.</a></u>                      </p>
                      <p>Outside open days, please contact us for advice on how and when visits might be arranged, and for further information on our various outreach activities. </p>
                      <p><br>
                        <strong>Further Information and Enquiries</strong><br>
                        Faculty of English<br>
                        9 West Road<br>
                        Cambridge<br>
                        CB3 9DP</p>
                      <p><br>
                        +44 (0)1223 335070<br>
                    <a href="mailto:english-faculty@lists.cam.ac.uk">english-faculty@lists.cam.ac.uk</a></p>
                      <p>&nbsp;</p>
                                        
                    <p>&nbsp;</p>


</div>

				</div>
			</div>
            
			<div class="column3 footer-navigation last">
				<div class="content-container navigation-list">

<script type='text/javascript'>
    $(function() {
        $.fn.scrollToTop = function() {
            $(this).hide().removeAttr("href");
            if ($(window).scrollTop() != "0") {
                $(this).fadeIn("slow")
            }
            var scrollDiv = $(this);
            $(window).scroll(function() {
                if ($(window).scrollTop() == "0") {
                    $(scrollDiv).fadeOut("slow")
                } else {
                    $(scrollDiv).fadeIn("slow")
                }
            });
            $(this).click(function() {
                $("html, body").animate({
                    scrollTop: 0
                }, "slow")
            })
        }
    });
    $(function() {
        $("#w2b-StoTop").scrollToTop();
    });
</script>

	<div id="content">
	<!--
		<div class="navigation">
			<div class="floatleft">&laquo; <a href="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/cambridgeauthors/byatt-intertextuality/" rel="prev">Byatt: Intertextuality</a></div>
			<div class="floatright"><a href="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/cambridgeauthors/byatt-place-of-poetry/" rel="next">Byatt: The Place of Poetry in Possession</a> &raquo;</div>
		</div>
-->
		<div class="post" id="post-660">
			<h2>Byatt: Intertextuality and Possession, A case study</h2>

			<div class="entry">
				<blockquote><p><em>Here undergraduate </em>Laura Kilbride <em>undertakes a critical experiment. The goal is to map out in visual form the intertextual relationships of a poem. The one chosen is &#39;Our Lady- bearing- Pain' (p. 381), written by A.S. Byatt in the fictional persona of Christabel LaMotte.</em></p></blockquote>
<br/>
<p>There are two main aspects of this experiment as it is presented here. First, the Byatt poem (on the left, below) has been marked with links to show its intersections with two poems by Emily Dickinson (on the right); when you run your mouse over a highlighted section of the left-hand poem, the relevant part(s) of the other will be highlighted. Secondly, the Byatt poem is annotated to keep track of what these connections are and what they mean to the poem. These notes often use <a id="tippy_tip0_9683_anchor"></a> terminology to describe the poetic effects. What we have here are two ways of annotating a text: one more traditional, the other (the dynamic highlighting) more innovative.</p>
<br/>
<table border="0">
<tbody>
<tr valign="top">
<td style="padding: 0 2em;"><a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h2' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,2);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(2);'>&#39;Our Lady- bearing- Pain'</a> <a id="tippy_tip1_7054_anchor"></a><br />
(Christabel LaMotte, i.e. A.S. Byatt, referred to in notes as CLM)<br/><br/>
<p><a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h2' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,2);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(2);'>Our Lady- bearing- Pain</a><br />
She bore what the Cross bears<br />
<a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h1' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,1);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(1);'>She bears and bears again</a> - <a id="tippy_tip2_7954_anchor"></a><br />
As the stone- bears- its scars<br />
The Hammer broke her out<br />
Of rough Rock's ancient- Sleep-<br />
And chiselled her about<br />
<a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h1' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,1);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(1);'>With stars that weep- that weep-</a><br />
The Pain inscribed in Rock-<br />
The Pain he bears- she <a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h3' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,3);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(3);'>Bore</a> <a id="tippy_tip3_3569_anchor"></a><br />
She hears the Poor Frame Crack-</p>
<p>And knows<a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h4' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,4);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(4);'> - </a>He'll<a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h4' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,4);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(4);'> - </a>come<a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h4' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,4);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(4);'> - </a> no More<a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h4' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,4);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(4);'> - </a><a id="tippy_tip4_6062_anchor"></a></p>
<p>It came all so still<br />
<a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h5' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,5);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(5);'>The little Thing-</a><a id="tippy_tip5_4036_anchor"></a><br />
And would not stay -<br />
Our Questioning -<br />
A heavy Breath<br />
One two and three -<br />
And then the lapsed<br />
Eternity -<br />
<a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h6' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,6);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(6);'>A Lapis Flesh<br />
The Crimson- Gone -<br />
It came as still<br />
As any Stone -</a> <a id="tippy_tip6_3334_anchor"></a><br />
My subject is Spilt Milk. <a id="tippy_tip7_3498_anchor"></a></p>
<p><a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h7' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,7);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(7);'>A white Disfigurement<br />
A quiet creeping Sleek<br />
Of squandered Nourishment</a> <a id="tippy_tip8_9143_anchor"></a></p>
<p>Others in a heavy Vase<br />
Raise darkly scented Wine -<br />
This warm and squirted White<br />
In solid Pot - was mine -<br />
And now a <a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h8' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,8);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(8);'>paradox</a><br />
A bleaching blot, <a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h8' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,8);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(8);'>a stain</a><br />
<a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h8' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,8);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(8);'>Of pure and innocent white</a> <a id="tippy_tip9_903_anchor"></a><br />
It goes to Earth again -<br />
Which smelled of summer Hay<br />
Of crunching Cow - Divine -<br />
Of warm flanks and of love<br />
More quiet, more still- than mine-<br />
It runs on table top<br />
It drips onto the <a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h9' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,9);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(9);'>G</a>round</p>
<p>We hear its liquid <a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h9' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,9);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(9);'>L</a>apse <a id="tippy_tip10_3083_anchor"></a></p>
<p>Wet on soft dust its sound.<br />
We run with milk and blood<br />
What we would give we spill<br />
The hungry mouths are raised<br />
We spill we fail to fill<br />
<a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h10' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,10);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(10);'>This</a> cannot be restored <a id="tippy_tip11_8544_anchor"></a><br />
<a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h10' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,10);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(10);'>This</a> flow cannot redeem<br />
<a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h10' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,10);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(10);'>This</a> white's not wiped away<br />
Though blanched we seem<br />
<a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h10' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,10);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(10);'>Howe'er</a> I wipe and wipe<br />
<a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h10' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,10);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(10);'>Howe'er</a> I frantic- <a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h11' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,11);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(11);'>scour</a><br />
The ghost of my spilled milk<br />
Makes my Air <a href='#' class='intertextual-h intertextual-h11' onMouseOver='intertextual_show(this,11);' onMouseOut='intertextual_hide(11);'>sour</a>. <a id="tippy_tip12_3801_anchor"></a></td>
<td class="ix-slippy" style="padding: 0 2em;"><span class='intertextual-t2'>&#39;I felt a Funeral, in my Brain'</span><br />
(Emily Dickinson, referred to in notes as ED)</p>
<br/><br/>
<p><span class='intertextual-t2'>I felt a Funeral, in my Brain,</span><br />
And Mourners to and fro<br />
<span class='intertextual-t1'>Kept treading<span class='intertextual-t4'> - </span>treading<span class='intertextual-t4'> - </span>till it seemed</span><br />
That <span class='intertextual-t9'>S</span>ense was breaking through-<br />
And when they all were seated,<br />
A <span class='intertextual-t9'>S</span>ervice, like a <span class='intertextual-t9'>D</span>rum-<br />
<span class='intertextual-t1'>Kept beating<span class='intertextual-t4'>- </span>beating<span class='intertextual-t4'> - </span>till I thought</span><br />
My Mind was going numb --<br />
<span class='intertextual-t7'>And then I heard them lift a Box<br />
And creak across my Soul<br />
With those same Boots of Lead, again,<br />
Then Space- began to toll,</span><br />
<span class='intertextual-t8'>As all the Heavens were a Bell,</span><br />
And Being, but an Ear,<br />
<span class='intertextual-t6'>And I, and <span class='intertextual-t8'>Silence,</span> some strange Race<br />
Wrecked, solitary, here-</span><br />
<span class='intertextual-t10'>And</span> then a Plank in Reason, broke,</p>
<p><span class='intertextual-t10'>And</span> I dropped down, and down-</p>
<p><span class='intertextual-t10'>And</span> hit a World, at every plunge,</p>
<p><span class='intertextual-t10'>And</span> <span class='intertextual-t5'>Finished knowing- then-</span></p>
<br/><br/><br/>
<p><span class='intertextual-t2'>Pain<span class='intertextual-t4'> - </span>has an Element of Blank</span><br />
(Emily Dickinson)</p>
<p><span class='intertextual-t2'>Pain<span class='intertextual-t4'> - </span>has an Element of Blank<span class='intertextual-t4'> -</span></span><br />
It cannot recollect<br />
When it begun- or if there were<br />
A time when it was not-<br />
It has no Future- but itself-<br />
Its Infinite <span class='intertextual-t11'>contain</span><br />
Its past- enlightened to perceive<br />
New <span class='intertextual-t3'>Periods</span> - of <span class='intertextual-t11'>Pain</span>.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<br/><br/>
<p><strong>Further Reading</strong></p>
<p>You might follow up this essay's turn towards rhetorical terminology by looking at one of the online resources devoted to it. There is a forest of rhetoric, for example, at <a href="http://humanities.byu.edu/rhetoric/Silva.htm" target="_blank">http://humanities.byu.edu/rhetoric/Silva.htm</a>. It is sometimes difficult to separate out the useful material from the volume of terms and definitions, but a precise critical vocabulary is worth some effort!</p>
<br/>
<p><strong>Further Thinking</strong></p>
<p>What do you think of this method? Do you think this helps uncover how a poem was written? Or does it tell us something else, e.g. how the poem seems to expect us to read it? Or might such colour-coding end up sacrificing coherence and poetic effect?</p>
<p>Whether or not you like the method, it's hard to deny that Byatt has carefully woven her characters and their works out of authors and their works. What difference does this awareness make to your reading of <em>Possession</em>?</p>
<p>In the notes you'll find some technical rhetorical terms describing poetic effects. What do you think such technical language adds to reading poetry?</p>
<div class="tippy" data-title="rhetorical" data-anchor="#tippy_tip0_9683_anchor" >Rhetoric is an ancient discipline that describes the technique of eloquent, persuasive speech. One of its most important aspects is a list of figures or tropes, ways in which language may be varied to good effect. Some of these are still very famous (e.g. metaphor, simile); others (e.g. bomphiologia, which means bragging exaggeration) are not. These terms can enable us to be precise about verbal effects.</div>
<div class="tippy" data-title="«note»" data-anchor="#tippy_tip1_7054_anchor" >Title: Like Emily Dickinson's poems, few of Christabel LaMotte's are actually given titles. Instead the first line of the poem is used. The lack of a definite title adds to the poem's enigmatic or riddling quality, removing the element of apparent intention that usually accompanies the choice of a title.</div>
<div class="tippy" data-title="«note»" data-anchor="#tippy_tip2_7954_anchor" >Repetition: Both CLM and ED make poetic use of repetition to emphasise the inescapable and overwhelming power of pain. In the ED poem the second instance of repetition within a line is also a structural repeat, with the verb and the dashes occurring in the same positions. This is a rhetorical figure usually termed isocolon.</div>
<div class="tippy" data-title="«note»" data-anchor="#tippy_tip3_3569_anchor" >Paranomasia or (as we would call it) pun: Here 'bore' functions in two ways: as the past tense of the verb 'to bear' and the verb meaning 'to drill' or 'to eat away at' something, suggesting the irascible nature of pain. The second meaning arises when considering the nearby image of the rock, usually a symbol of impregnability. ED also makes use of puns to express pain. The word 'Period', which (in American-English) means a final clause completed by a full stop, also refers to a quantity of time. The pun on 'Period' is therefore ironic, as the time period of pain is 'Infinite' and will not stop when a sentence stops.</div>
<div class="tippy" data-title="«note»" data-anchor="#tippy_tip4_6062_anchor" >Dash: Both ED and CLM make poetic use of this type of punctuation in their poems. In CLM the dash breaks up the flow of speech to convey the speech of a suffering persona, for whom forming complete sentences proves too difficult. C.f. 'Pain- has an Element of Blank' In ED the dash also creates a dramatic pause, causing the reader to dwell on each word as a unit or image in itself. Here the reader is led to focus on a verb of repetitive movement, contributing to the effect of the repetition which presents the incessant experience of pain.</div>
<div class="tippy" data-title="«note»" data-anchor="#tippy_tip5_4036_anchor" >Enigma: Both poems are enigmatic or riddling. The focus is on the reader to create a whole narrative from the fragments of speech broken up by and joined by the dashes.</div>
<div class="tippy" data-title="«note»" data-anchor="#tippy_tip6_3334_anchor" >Asyndeton: The occurrence of words or parts of speech not joined by conjunctions (e.g. and, but), technically known as asyndeton, produces a sense of a confused speaker, while contributing to the sense of the poem as an enigma.</div>
<div class="tippy" data-title="«note»" data-anchor="#tippy_tip7_3498_anchor" >Allusion: Two forms of allusion are present here, one local and one general. Though CLM is Byatt's Victorian poet, Byatt may be alluding to a short poem by W.B. Yeats called 'Spilt Milk' ('We that have done and thought, / That have thought and done, / Must ramble, and thin out / Like milk spilt on a stone'). However, a more general form of intertextuality may be at work, as the proverbial phrase 'There's no use crying over spilt milk' hovers at the back of the reader's mind. The supposed death of a child which leaves the lactating mother with milk in her breasts, but no child to feed, is certainly worth crying over. In this instance the allusion works against its original proverbial context, creating tragic irony.</div>
<div class="tippy" data-title="«note»" data-anchor="#tippy_tip8_9143_anchor" >Rhyme scheme: Though LaMotte's poem is trimetric - that is, in trimeter, or divided into three 'feet' or metrical units, each consisting of an unstressed syllable followed by a stressed syllable - rather than borrowing Dickinson's tetrameter (a metre consisting of four feet in a line), both poems use a similar rhyme scheme based on an abcb pattern. The scheme is less ballad-like and sing-song than the standard abab rhyme scheme, yet is still able to exploit all the poetic effects which accompany rhyme. See the last note, below.</div>
<div class="tippy" data-title="«note»" data-anchor="#tippy_tip9_903_anchor" > Paradox: Both poets make use of paradox in an effort to convey the illogical or inexplicable experience of pain.</div>
<div class="tippy" data-title="«note»" data-anchor="#tippy_tip10_3083_anchor" >Capitalisation: Both CLM and ED capitalise words in addition to proper nouns and the beginning of sentences. This emphasises the word in question, prompting the reader to stress the word in reading. Occasionally this also creates proper nouns or concepts of things, so that in the CLM poem a 'Lapse' is imagined as a unique and self-contained movement, as the drop of milk falls to the floor.</div>
<div class="tippy" data-title="«note»" data-anchor="#tippy_tip11_8544_anchor" >Anaphora: repeating the same word at the beginning of the line for several consecutive lines. Both poets do this for poetic and emphatic effect.</div>
<div class="tippy" data-title="«note»" data-anchor="#tippy_tip12_3801_anchor" >Anticipatory rhyme: The rhyme-scheme abcb creates anticipatory rhymes, opening up a number of possible rhymes to the reader's ear at the first b line. These are then completed by the answering b rhyme in the last line of the stanza. This technique, used by both poets, yokes words and concepts together across the stanza.</div>

								
				<p class="postmetadata alt">
					<small>

<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[



/* JQUERY */

jQuery(document).ready(function(){  

 
	/* For IE6 */
	if (jQuery.browser.msie && /MSIE 6\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent) && !/MSIE 7\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent) && !/MSIE 8\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent)) {

		/* Max-width for images in IE6 */		
		var centerwidth = jQuery("td#middle").width(); 
		
		/* Images without caption */
		jQuery(".post img").each(function() { 
			var maxwidth = centerwidth - 10 + 'px';
			var imgwidth = jQuery(this).width(); 
			var imgheight = jQuery(this).height(); 
			var newimgheight = (centerwidth / imgwidth * imgheight) + 'px';	
			if (imgwidth > centerwidth) { 
				jQuery(this).css({width: maxwidth}); 
				jQuery(this).css({height: newimgheight}); 
			}
		});
		
		/* Images with caption */
		jQuery("div.wp-caption").each(function() { 
			var captionwidth = jQuery(this).width(); 
			var maxcaptionwidth = centerwidth + 'px';
			var captionheight = jQuery(this).height();
			var captionimgwidth =  jQuery("div.wp-caption img").width();
			var captionimgheight =  jQuery("div.wp-caption img").height();
			if (captionwidth > centerwidth) { 
				jQuery(this).css({width: maxcaptionwidth}); 
				var newcaptionheight = (centerwidth / captionwidth * captionheight) + 'px';
				var newcaptionimgheight = (centerwidth / captionimgwidth * captionimgheight) + 'px';
				jQuery(this).css({height: newcaptionheight}); 
				jQuery("div.wp-caption img").css({height: newcaptionimgheight}); 
				}
		});
		
		/* sfhover for LI:HOVER support in IE6: */
		jQuery("ul li").
			hover( function() {
					jQuery(this).addClass("sfhover")
				}, 
				function() {
					jQuery(this).removeClass("sfhover")
				} 
			); 

	/* End IE6 */
	}
	
	jQuery(".post table tr").
		mouseover(function() {
			jQuery(this).addClass("over");
		}).
		mouseout(function() {
			jQuery(this).removeClass("over");
		});

	
	jQuery(".post table.zebra tr:even").
		addClass("alt");	

	
	jQuery("input.text, input.TextField, input.file, input.password, textarea").
		focus(function () {  
			jQuery(this).addClass("highlight"); 
		}).
		blur(function () { 
			jQuery(this).removeClass("highlight"); 
		})
	
	jQuery("input.inputblur").
		focus(function () {  
			jQuery(this).addClass("inputfocus"); 
		}).
		blur(function () { 
			jQuery(this).removeClass("inputfocus"); 
		})

		

	
	jQuery("input.button, input.Button").
		mouseover(function() {
			jQuery(this).addClass("buttonhover");
		}).
		mouseout(function() {
			jQuery(this).removeClass("buttonhover");
		});

	/* toggle "you can use these xhtml tags" */
	jQuery("a.xhtmltags").
		click(function(){ 
			jQuery("div.xhtml-tags").slideToggle(300); 
		});

	/* For the Tabbed Widgets plugin: */
	jQuery("ul.tw-nav-list").
		addClass("clearfix");

		
	
});

//]]>
</script>
<!--[if IE 6]>
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/converse/wp-content/themes/conversetheme/js/DD_roundies.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">DD_roundies.addRule('a.posts-icon, a.comments-icon, a.email-icon, img.logo');</script>
<![endif]-->
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery(document).ready(function($) {
   $('.popup').click(function() {
     var NWin = window.open($(this).prop('href'), '', 'scrollbars=1,height=600,width=800');
     if (window.focus)
     {
       NWin.focus();
     }
     return false;
    });
});
</script>

	<li class="page_item page-item-82 page_item_has_children"><a href="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/converse/ks3-ks4/gcse-first-world-war/">GCSE &#8211; First World War</a></li>

</ul>
</li>
<li class="page_item page-item-47 page_item_has_children current_page_ancestor current_page_parent"><a href="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/converse/47-2/">A-Level</a>

		<!-- Main Column -->
		<td id="middle">

	

		
		 

		
<div class="post post-152 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-152">


<div class="post-headline">		<h1>A-Level &#8211; Study Skills</h1>
		</div>

<div class="post-bodycopy clearfix"><table border="0">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td colspan="2"><img src="/converse/images/boundaries/alevel-top.gif" alt="" width="677" height="16" /></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="16" valign="top"><img src="/converse/images/boundaries/alevel-left.gif" alt="" width="16" height="271" /></td>
<td>
<table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>If you&#8217;re about to start studying AS or A2 English Literature or Language, here are some tips to get you started.</p>
<p>AS and A2 build on the skills and knowledge that you developed while studying for your GCSEs, but<br />
you&#8217;ll probably find the A-level course more demanding. At A-level, you&#8217;ll be starting to think more<br />
about the historical context in which the authors you study were writing &#8211; for example, how do Shakespeare&#8217;s<br />
plays reflect the worries and opportunities of living in Elizabethan London? You&#8217;ll also be thinking more<br />
about the reasons <em>why</em> an author wrote the way they did, looking closely at the way in which they argue a point and<br />
phrase their language. Don&#8217;t forget that it&#8217;s never enough to describe what an author says &#8211; you have to say <em>why</em> they&#8217;re<br />
saying it like that!</p>
<p>AS and A2 English are far more about skills than facts, and these skills will probably be<br />
new to you &#8211; so be prepared for a steep learning curve at the beginning of your course. To give you a hand, we&#8217;ve<br />
talked to teachers and examiners to get their top tips for studying English. Follow any of the links below to get<br />
started.</p>
<table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td align="center" valign="top"><a href="?page_id=156"><img src="/converse/images/links/exam_essays.gif" border="0" alt="Ten top tips - exam essays" /></a></td>
<td><a class="display" href="?page_id=156">Ten top tips for exam essays</a></p>
<h5><span> </span></p>
<li>Tips for writing exam essays by a Cambridge teacher and examiner.</li>
<p><span> </span></h5>
</td>
<td></td>
<td valign="top"><img src="/converse/images/icons/ks4_icon.gif" border="0" alt="for KS4 students" /><img src="/converse/images/shim.gif" border="0" alt="" width="5" /><img src="/converse/images/icons/a_icon.gif" border="0" alt="for AS and A2 students" /><img src="/converse/images/shim.gif" border="0" alt="" width="5" /><img src="/converse/images/icons/printer_icon.gif" border="0" alt="suitable for printing out" /><img src="/converse/images/shim.gif" border="0" alt="" width="5" /></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="center" valign="top"><a href="?pageid=164"><img src="/converse/images/links/revision_tips.gif" border="0" alt="Ten top tips - revision_tips" /></a></td>
<td><a class="display" href="?page_id=164">Ten top tips for revision</a></p>
<h5><span> </span></p>
<li>Tips for revising by a Cambridge teacher and examiner.</li>
<p><span> </span></h5>
</td>
<td></td>
<td valign="top"><img src="/converse/images/icons/ks4_icon.gif" border="0" alt="for KS4 students" /><img src="/converse/images/shim.gif" border="0" alt="" width="5" /><img src="/converse/images/icons/a_icon.gif" border="0" alt="for AS and A2 students" /><img src="/converse/images/shim.gif" border="0" alt="" width="5" /><img src="/converse/images/icons/printer_icon.gif" border="0" alt="suitable for printing out" /><img src="/converse/images/shim.gif" border="0" alt="" width="5" /></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="center" valign="top"><a href="?page_id=168"><img src="/converse/images/links/how_to_look_clever.gif" border="0" alt="How to look clever- without even trying!" /></a></td>
<td><a class="display" href="?page_id=168">Need some help to improve your coursework essays? Get advice from a teacher at Cambridge University. &#8211; Part 1 &#8211; The Quick Guide to Quotations</a></p>
<p><a class="display" href="/converse/essays/quotation/quotation1.acds"> </a></p>
<h5><span> </span></p>
<li>The first resource works through how students should use quotations in their coursework essays.</li>
<li>It then gives a number of examples and asks whether the example uses quotations correctly. It covers<br />
both the punctuation of the quotation and how best to use it to prove a point in an essay.</li>
<p><span> </span></h5>
</td>
<td></td>
<td valign="top"><img src="/converse/images/icons/ks4_icon.gif" border="0" alt="for KS4 students" /><img src="/converse/images/shim.gif" border="0" alt="" width="5" /><img src="/converse/images/icons/a_icon.gif" border="0" alt="for AS and A2 students" /><img src="/converse/images/shim.gif" border="0" alt="" width="5" /><img src="/converse/images/icons/printer_icon.gif" border="0" alt="suitable for printing out" /><img src="/converse/images/shim.gif" border="0" alt="" width="5" /></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="center" valign="top"><a href="/converse/essays/essaywriting/index.htm"><img src="/converse/images/links/how_to_look_clever.gif" border="0" alt="How to look clever- without even trying!" /></a></td>
<td><a class="display" href="/converse/essays/essaywriting/index.htm">Part 2 &#8211; The Quick Guide to Better Essay Writing<br />
</a></p>
<h5><span> </span></p>
<li>This guide to better essay writing would be particularly useful for students working on coursework essays.</li>
<p><span> </span></h5>
</td>
<td></td>
<td valign="top"><img src="/converse/images/icons/ks4_icon.gif" border="0" alt="for KS4 students" /><img src="/converse/images/shim.gif" border="0" alt="" width="5" /><img src="/converse/images/icons/a_icon.gif" border="0" alt="for AS and A2 students" /><img src="/converse/images/shim.gif" border="0" alt="" width="5" /><img src="/converse/images/icons/printer_icon.gif" border="0" alt="suitable for printing out" /><img src="/converse/images/shim.gif" border="0" alt="" width="5" /></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="center" valign="top"><a href="?page_id=177"><img src="/converse/images/links/read_a_poem.gif" border="0" alt="How to read a poem" /></a></td>
<td><a class="display" href="?page_id=177">See how a Cambridge student reads a poem and plans an essay about it.</a></p>
<h5><span> </span></p>
<li>This resource aims to give A-level students a strategy and example for reading a poem.</li>
<li>We asked a Cambridge student to read a poem as though they were going to write an essay on it, and<br />
to write down their thoughts as they went through it. The student then wrote an essay plan.</li>
<li>The poem being studied is by Tennyson, &#8216;Now sleeps the crimson petal&#8217;.</li>
<li>The resource ends with tips on how to read a poem, and on essay writing.</li>
<li>It could be used either by individual students or in groups, with students writing their own commentary on the same poem.</li>
<p><span> </span></h5>
</td>
<td></td>
<td valign="top"><img src="/converse/images/icons/a_icon.gif" border="0" alt="for AS and A2 students" /><img src="/converse/images/shim.gif" border="0" alt="" width="5" /><img src="/converse/images/icons/printer_icon.gif" border="0" alt="suitable for printing out" /><img src="/converse/images/shim.gif" border="0" alt="" width="5" /></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="center" valign="top"><a onclick="popUpWin(this.href,'console',750,500);return false;" href="/converse/movies/daniel_praccrit.swf"><img src="/converse/images/links/poem_reader.gif" border="0" alt="Practical Criticism - Daniel" /></a></td>
<td><a class="display" onclick="popUpWin(this.href,'console',750,500);return false;" href="/converse/movies/daniel_praccrit.swf">Improve your close reading skills with this in-depth multimedia exploration of a poem.</a></p>
<h5><span> </span></p>
<li>This resource looks at a poem by 17th century writer Samuel Daniel.</li>
<li>The activity is designed to help students deal with poetry they find difficult, by encouraging them to recognise which words and phrases they find difficult and why.</li>
<li>The activity uses the metaphor of zooming into the poem to remind students that close reading really is about looking at the poetry in detail.</li>
<li>As the students move their mice over the screen, a magnifying glass will appear. If students click on this, they will zoom into the poem.</li>
<li>The resource concentrates on asking questions about the poem, and in provoking the students to ask their own questions.</li>
<li>Students with visual impairments can right-click on the resource to view an enlarged version.</li>
<li>For more suggestions on using this resource in the classroom, please see our teacher&#8217;s handbook.</li>
</h5>
</td>
<td></td>
<td valign="top"><img src="/converse/images/icons/a_icon.gif" border="0" alt="for AS and A2 students" /><img src="/converse/images/shim.gif" border="0" alt="" width="5" /><img src="/converse/images/icons/anim_icon.gif" border="0" alt="an interactive, multimedia resource" /><img src="/converse/images/shim.gif" border="0" alt="" width="5" /></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="center" valign="top"><a href="?page_id=183"><img src="/converse/images/links/writing_researching.gif" border="0" alt="How to write an essay" /></a></td>
<td><a class="display" href="?page_id=183">Find out how one academic goes about researching and writing his articles. Can you get some ideas for writing your own essays?</a></p>
<h5><span></p>
<li>The resource is part of a larger essay on Shakespeare&#8217;s schooling. The section detailing the academic&#8217;s writing and researching process is found towards the end.
<li>This resouce was written by a Cambridge Academic and explores the process of researching and writing an article.</li>
<li>It could be used to encourage students to think more about their own writing process, and to remind them that it is important to have<br />
their ideas clear before they begin writing.</li>
<p></span><span> </span></h5>
</td>
<td></td>
<td valign="top"><img src="/converse/images/icons/a_icon.gif" border="0" alt="for AS and A2 students" /><img src="/converse/images/shim.gif" border="0" alt="" width="5" /><img src="/converse/images/icons/anim_icon.gif" border="0" alt="an interactive, multimedia resource" /><img src="/converse/images/shim.gif" border="0" alt="" width="5" /></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>


</div><!-- / Post -->						
	
	

		
			



</td>
<!-- / Main Column -->



</tr>

a{-webkit-border-top-left-radius:0;-webkit-border-top-right-radius:0;-moz-border-radius-topleft:0;-moz-border-radius-topright:0;border-top-left-radius:0;border-top-right-radius:0}</style>
<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[



/* JQUERY */

jQuery(document).ready(function(){  

 
	/* For IE6 */
	if (jQuery.browser.msie && /MSIE 6\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent) && !/MSIE 7\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent) && !/MSIE 8\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent)) {

		/* Max-width for images in IE6 */		
		var centerwidth = jQuery("td#middle").width(); 
		
		/* Images without caption */
		jQuery(".post img").each(function() { 
			var maxwidth = centerwidth - 10 + 'px';
			var imgwidth = jQuery(this).width(); 
			var imgheight = jQuery(this).height(); 
			var newimgheight = (centerwidth / imgwidth * imgheight) + 'px';	
			if (imgwidth > centerwidth) { 
				jQuery(this).css({width: maxwidth}); 
				jQuery(this).css({height: newimgheight}); 
			}
		});
		
		/* Images with caption */
		jQuery("div.wp-caption").each(function() { 
			var captionwidth = jQuery(this).width(); 
			var maxcaptionwidth = centerwidth + 'px';
			var captionheight = jQuery(this).height();
			var captionimgwidth =  jQuery("div.wp-caption img").width();
			var captionimgheight =  jQuery("div.wp-caption img").height();
			if (captionwidth > centerwidth) { 
				jQuery(this).css({width: maxcaptionwidth}); 
				var newcaptionheight = (centerwidth / captionwidth * captionheight) + 'px';
				var newcaptionimgheight = (centerwidth / captionimgwidth * captionimgheight) + 'px';
				jQuery(this).css({height: newcaptionheight}); 
				jQuery("div.wp-caption img").css({height: newcaptionimgheight}); 
				}
		});
		
		/* sfhover for LI:HOVER support in IE6: */
		jQuery("ul li").
			hover( function() {
					jQuery(this).addClass("sfhover")
				}, 
				function() {
					jQuery(this).removeClass("sfhover")
				} 
			); 

	/* End IE6 */
	}
	
	jQuery(".post table tr").
		mouseover(function() {
			jQuery(this).addClass("over");
		}).
		mouseout(function() {
			jQuery(this).removeClass("over");
		});

	
	jQuery(".post table.zebra tr:even").
		addClass("alt");	

	
	jQuery("input.text, input.TextField, input.file, input.password, textarea").
		focus(function () {  
			jQuery(this).addClass("highlight"); 
		}).
		blur(function () { 
			jQuery(this).removeClass("highlight"); 
		})
	
	jQuery("input.inputblur").
		focus(function () {  
			jQuery(this).addClass("inputfocus"); 
		}).
		blur(function () { 
			jQuery(this).removeClass("inputfocus"); 
		})

		

	
	jQuery("input.button, input.Button").
		mouseover(function() {
			jQuery(this).addClass("buttonhover");
		}).
		mouseout(function() {
			jQuery(this).removeClass("buttonhover");
		});

	/* toggle "you can use these xhtml tags" */
	jQuery("a.xhtmltags").
		click(function(){ 
			jQuery("div.xhtml-tags").slideToggle(300); 
		});

	/* For the Tabbed Widgets plugin: */
	jQuery("ul.tw-nav-list").
		addClass("clearfix");

		
	
});

//]]>
</script>
<!--[if IE 6]>
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/converse/wp-content/themes/conversetheme/js/DD_roundies.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">DD_roundies.addRule('a.posts-icon, a.comments-icon, a.email-icon, img.logo');</script>
<![endif]-->

jQuery(document).ready(function($) {
   $('.popup').click(function() {
     var NWin = window.open($(this).prop('href'), '', 'scrollbars=1,height=600,width=800');
     if (window.focus)
     {
       NWin.focus();
     }
     return false;
    });
});
</script>

<div class="post post-49 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-49">


<div class="post-headline">		<h1>Degrees / Careers</h1>
		</div>

<div class="post-bodycopy clearfix"><table border="0">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td colspan="2"><img src="/converse/images/boundaries/degree-top.gif" alt="" width="677" height="16" /></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="16" valign="top"><img src="/converse/images/boundaries/degree-left.gif" alt="" width="16" height="271" /></td>
<td>
<table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Thinking about studying English at A-level or university?</p>
<p>Worried about future careers? or wondering what university might be like?</p>
<table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td rowspan="3"><a href="?page_id=417"><img src="/converse/images/icons/sangkhlasplash.jpg" border="0" alt="6 Careers you won't have thought of" /></a></td>
<td><!--a href="/converse/degree/money.acds"><img src="/converse/images/links/moneyworries.gif" mce_src="/converse/images/links/moneyworries.gif" alt="money worries?" border="0" /></a--></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href="?page_id=406"><img src="/converse/images/links/english_at_university.gif" border="0" alt="studying English at University" /></a></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href="?page_id=411"><img src="/converse/images/links/students_story.gif" border="0" alt="one student's story" /></a></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>

<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[



/* JQUERY */

jQuery(document).ready(function(){  

 
	/* For IE6 */
	if (jQuery.browser.msie && /MSIE 6\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent) && !/MSIE 7\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent) && !/MSIE 8\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent)) {

		/* Max-width for images in IE6 */		
		var centerwidth = jQuery("td#middle").width(); 
		
		/* Images without caption */
		jQuery(".post img").each(function() { 
			var maxwidth = centerwidth - 10 + 'px';
			var imgwidth = jQuery(this).width(); 
			var imgheight = jQuery(this).height(); 
			var newimgheight = (centerwidth / imgwidth * imgheight) + 'px';	
			if (imgwidth > centerwidth) { 
				jQuery(this).css({width: maxwidth}); 
				jQuery(this).css({height: newimgheight}); 
			}
		});
		
		/* Images with caption */
		jQuery("div.wp-caption").each(function() { 
			var captionwidth = jQuery(this).width(); 
			var maxcaptionwidth = centerwidth + 'px';
			var captionheight = jQuery(this).height();
			var captionimgwidth =  jQuery("div.wp-caption img").width();
			var captionimgheight =  jQuery("div.wp-caption img").height();
			if (captionwidth > centerwidth) { 
				jQuery(this).css({width: maxcaptionwidth}); 
				var newcaptionheight = (centerwidth / captionwidth * captionheight) + 'px';
				var newcaptionimgheight = (centerwidth / captionimgwidth * captionimgheight) + 'px';
				jQuery(this).css({height: newcaptionheight}); 
				jQuery("div.wp-caption img").css({height: newcaptionimgheight}); 
				}
		});
		
		/* sfhover for LI:HOVER support in IE6: */
		jQuery("ul li").
			hover( function() {
					jQuery(this).addClass("sfhover")
				}, 
				function() {
					jQuery(this).removeClass("sfhover")
				} 
			); 

	/* End IE6 */
	}
	
	jQuery(".post table tr").
		mouseover(function() {
			jQuery(this).addClass("over");
		}).
		mouseout(function() {
			jQuery(this).removeClass("over");
		});

	
	jQuery(".post table.zebra tr:even").
		addClass("alt");	

	
	jQuery("input.text, input.TextField, input.file, input.password, textarea").
		focus(function () {  
			jQuery(this).addClass("highlight"); 
		}).
		blur(function () { 
			jQuery(this).removeClass("highlight"); 
		})
	
	jQuery("input.inputblur").
		focus(function () {  
			jQuery(this).addClass("inputfocus"); 
		}).
		blur(function () { 
			jQuery(this).removeClass("inputfocus"); 
		})

		

	
	jQuery("input.button, input.Button").
		mouseover(function() {
			jQuery(this).addClass("buttonhover");
		}).
		mouseout(function() {
			jQuery(this).removeClass("buttonhover");
		});

	/* toggle "you can use these xhtml tags" */
	jQuery("a.xhtmltags").
		click(function(){ 
			jQuery("div.xhtml-tags").slideToggle(300); 
		});

	/* For the Tabbed Widgets plugin: */
	jQuery("ul.tw-nav-list").
		addClass("clearfix");

		
	
});

//]]>
</script>
<!--[if IE 6]>
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/converse/wp-content/themes/conversetheme/js/DD_roundies.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">DD_roundies.addRule('a.posts-icon, a.comments-icon, a.email-icon, img.logo');</script>
<![endif]-->
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery(document).ready(function($) {
   $('.popup').click(function() {
     var NWin = window.open($(this).prop('href'), '', 'scrollbars=1,height=600,width=800');
     if (window.focus)
     {
       NWin.focus();
     }
     return false;
    });
});
</script>

		<td id="middle">

	

		
		 

		
<div class="post post-454 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-454">


<div class="post-headline">		<h1>Careers in English</h1>
		</div>

<div class="post-bodycopy clearfix"><table border="0">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td colspan="2"><img src="/converse/images/boundaries/degree-top.gif" alt="" width="677" height="16" /></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="16" valign="top"><img src="/converse/images/boundaries/degree-left.gif" alt="" width="16" height="271" /></td>
<td>
<table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>What sort of careers can English degrees lead to?</p>
<table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td width="50%"><img src="/converse/images/links/quotes_right.gif" alt="" /><strong>My parents were really worried when I said I wanted to study English at university &#8211; they thought I&#8217;d never get a job and get into massive debt for nothing.<br />
They wanted me to study maths instead &#8211; so I could get a good job in IT when I finished. After a lot of arguments, I studied English anyway &#8211; and I still got a job in computing!</strong><img src="/converse/images/links/quotes_right.gif" alt="" /></td>
<td>The real answer is that they could lead to almost anything &#8211; English graduates go on to careers in accountancy and IT, for example, as much as careers in management and business.</p>
<p>Every year, thousands of employers visit universities throughout the country to recruit students as they finish their degrees &#8211; and the majority of them are delighted to interview English students (just to check, we went round and asked them all&#8230;)</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p><a class="display" href="?page_id=411"><br />
<img src="/converse/images/links/students_story.gif" border="0" alt="the student's story" />Read one English student&#8217;s experiences.</a></p>
<p><a class="display" href="?page_id=417"><br />
<img src="/converse/images/links/careers_you_wont_have_thought_of.gif" border="0" alt="careers you won't have thought of" />Find out about four jobs you won&#8217;t have thought of.</a></p>
<p>The best place to really start looking is on the UK&#8217;s official graduate careers website, <a href="http://www.prospects.ac.uk" target="_blank"><br />
Prospects</a>. This site has information on everything from improving interview skills to jobs available in your region.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>


</div><!-- / Post -->						
	
	

		
			



</td>
<!-- / Main Column -->



</tr>
<!-- / Main Body -->
<tr>

<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[



/* JQUERY */

jQuery(document).ready(function(){  

 
	/* For IE6 */
	if (jQuery.browser.msie && /MSIE 6\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent) && !/MSIE 7\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent) && !/MSIE 8\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent)) {

		/* Max-width for images in IE6 */		
		var centerwidth = jQuery("td#middle").width(); 
		
		/* Images without caption */
		jQuery(".post img").each(function() { 
			var maxwidth = centerwidth - 10 + 'px';
			var imgwidth = jQuery(this).width(); 
			var imgheight = jQuery(this).height(); 
			var newimgheight = (centerwidth / imgwidth * imgheight) + 'px';	
			if (imgwidth > centerwidth) { 
				jQuery(this).css({width: maxwidth}); 
				jQuery(this).css({height: newimgheight}); 
			}
		});
		
		/* Images with caption */
		jQuery("div.wp-caption").each(function() { 
			var captionwidth = jQuery(this).width(); 
			var maxcaptionwidth = centerwidth + 'px';
			var captionheight = jQuery(this).height();
			var captionimgwidth =  jQuery("div.wp-caption img").width();
			var captionimgheight =  jQuery("div.wp-caption img").height();
			if (captionwidth > centerwidth) { 
				jQuery(this).css({width: maxcaptionwidth}); 
				var newcaptionheight = (centerwidth / captionwidth * captionheight) + 'px';
				var newcaptionimgheight = (centerwidth / captionimgwidth * captionimgheight) + 'px';
				jQuery(this).css({height: newcaptionheight}); 
				jQuery("div.wp-caption img").css({height: newcaptionimgheight}); 
				}
		});
		
		/* sfhover for LI:HOVER support in IE6: */
		jQuery("ul li").
			hover( function() {
					jQuery(this).addClass("sfhover")
				}, 
				function() {
					jQuery(this).removeClass("sfhover")
				} 
			); 

	/* End IE6 */
	}
	
	jQuery(".post table tr").
		mouseover(function() {
			jQuery(this).addClass("over");
		}).
		mouseout(function() {
			jQuery(this).removeClass("over");
		});

	
	jQuery(".post table.zebra tr:even").
		addClass("alt");	

	
	jQuery("input.text, input.TextField, input.file, input.password, textarea").
		focus(function () {  
			jQuery(this).addClass("highlight"); 
		}).
		blur(function () { 
			jQuery(this).removeClass("highlight"); 
		})
	
	jQuery("input.inputblur").
		focus(function () {  
			jQuery(this).addClass("inputfocus"); 
		}).
		blur(function () { 
			jQuery(this).removeClass("inputfocus"); 
		})

		

	
	jQuery("input.button, input.Button").
		mouseover(function() {
			jQuery(this).addClass("buttonhover");
		}).
		mouseout(function() {
			jQuery(this).removeClass("buttonhover");
		});

	/* toggle "you can use these xhtml tags" */
	jQuery("a.xhtmltags").
		click(function(){ 
			jQuery("div.xhtml-tags").slideToggle(300); 
		});

	/* For the Tabbed Widgets plugin: */
	jQuery("ul.tw-nav-list").
		addClass("clearfix");

		
	
});

//]]>
</script>
<!--[if IE 6]>
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/converse/wp-content/themes/conversetheme/js/DD_roundies.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">DD_roundies.addRule('a.posts-icon, a.comments-icon, a.email-icon, img.logo');</script>
<![endif]-->
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery(document).ready(function($) {
   $('.popup').click(function() {
     var NWin = window.open($(this).prop('href'), '', 'scrollbars=1,height=600,width=800');
     if (window.focus)
     {
       NWin.focus();
     }
     return false;
    });
});
</script>

<div class="post post-417 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-417">


<div class="post-headline">		<h1>Careers You Wouldn&#8217;t Have Thought Of</h1>
		</div>

<div class="post-bodycopy clearfix"><table border="0">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td colspan="2"><img src="/converse/images/boundaries/degree-top.gif" alt="" width="677" height="16" /></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="16" valign="top"><img src="/converse/images/boundaries/degree-left.gif" alt="" width="16" height="271" /></td>
<td>
<table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<p>What do English students go on to do after they graduate? Does studying English<br />
really mean you have to become an English teacher?</p>
<p>Find out what these former English students do now&#8230;</p>
<table></table>
<table width="100%">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td><a class="display" href="?page_id=420">The software developer</a></td>
<td><a href="?page_id=420"><img src="/converse/images/htatwork_small.jpg" border="0" alt="" /></a></td>
<td><a class="display" href="?page_id=432">The development worker</a></td>
<td><a href="b?page_id=432"><img src="/converse/images/sangkhla_small.jpg" border="0" alt="" /></a></td>
</tr>
<tr>

<td><a href="?page_id=438"><img src="/converse/images/bank_small.jpg" border="0" alt="" /></a></td>
</tr>

<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[



/* JQUERY */

jQuery(document).ready(function(){  

 
	/* For IE6 */
	if (jQuery.browser.msie && /MSIE 6\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent) && !/MSIE 7\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent) && !/MSIE 8\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent)) {

		/* Max-width for images in IE6 */		
		var centerwidth = jQuery("td#middle").width(); 
		
		/* Images without caption */
		jQuery(".post img").each(function() { 
			var maxwidth = centerwidth - 10 + 'px';
			var imgwidth = jQuery(this).width(); 
			var imgheight = jQuery(this).height(); 
			var newimgheight = (centerwidth / imgwidth * imgheight) + 'px';	
			if (imgwidth > centerwidth) { 
				jQuery(this).css({width: maxwidth}); 
				jQuery(this).css({height: newimgheight}); 
			}
		});
		
		/* Images with caption */
		jQuery("div.wp-caption").each(function() { 
			var captionwidth = jQuery(this).width(); 
			var maxcaptionwidth = centerwidth + 'px';
			var captionheight = jQuery(this).height();
			var captionimgwidth =  jQuery("div.wp-caption img").width();
			var captionimgheight =  jQuery("div.wp-caption img").height();
			if (captionwidth > centerwidth) { 
				jQuery(this).css({width: maxcaptionwidth}); 
				var newcaptionheight = (centerwidth / captionwidth * captionheight) + 'px';
				var newcaptionimgheight = (centerwidth / captionimgwidth * captionimgheight) + 'px';
				jQuery(this).css({height: newcaptionheight}); 
				jQuery("div.wp-caption img").css({height: newcaptionimgheight}); 
				}
		});
		
		/* sfhover for LI:HOVER support in IE6: */
		jQuery("ul li").
			hover( function() {
					jQuery(this).addClass("sfhover")
				}, 
				function() {
					jQuery(this).removeClass("sfhover")
				} 
			); 

	/* End IE6 */
	}
	
	jQuery(".post table tr").
		mouseover(function() {
			jQuery(this).addClass("over");
		}).
		mouseout(function() {
			jQuery(this).removeClass("over");
		});

	
	jQuery(".post table.zebra tr:even").
		addClass("alt");	

	
	jQuery("input.text, input.TextField, input.file, input.password, textarea").
		focus(function () {  
			jQuery(this).addClass("highlight"); 
		}).
		blur(function () { 
			jQuery(this).removeClass("highlight"); 
		})
	
	jQuery("input.inputblur").
		focus(function () {  
			jQuery(this).addClass("inputfocus"); 
		}).
		blur(function () { 
			jQuery(this).removeClass("inputfocus"); 
		})

		

	
	jQuery("input.button, input.Button").
		mouseover(function() {
			jQuery(this).addClass("buttonhover");
		}).
		mouseout(function() {
			jQuery(this).removeClass("buttonhover");
		});

	/* toggle "you can use these xhtml tags" */
	jQuery("a.xhtmltags").
		click(function(){ 
			jQuery("div.xhtml-tags").slideToggle(300); 
		});

	/* For the Tabbed Widgets plugin: */
	jQuery("ul.tw-nav-list").
		addClass("clearfix");

		
	
});

//]]>
</script>
<!--[if IE 6]>
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/converse/wp-content/themes/conversetheme/js/DD_roundies.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">DD_roundies.addRule('a.posts-icon, a.comments-icon, a.email-icon, img.logo');</script>
<![endif]-->
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery(document).ready(function($) {
   $('.popup').click(function() {
     var NWin = window.open($(this).prop('href'), '', 'scrollbars=1,height=600,width=800');
     if (window.focus)
     {
       NWin.focus();
     }
     return false;
    });
});
</script>

		<td id="left">

			<div id="search-2" class="widget widget_search"><div class="widget-title"><h3>Search Converse</h3></div><form method="get" class="searchform" action="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/converse/">
<table class="searchform" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0">
<tr>
<td class="searchfield">
<input type="text" class="text inputblur" value="" name="s" />
</td>
<td class="searchbutton">

</td>
</tr></table>

		<!-- / Left Sidebar -->
		
				

		<!-- Main Column -->
		<td id="middle">

	

		
		 

		
<div class="post post-406 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-406">


<div class="post-headline">		<h1>English at University</h1>
		</div>

<div class="post-bodycopy clearfix"><table border="0">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td colspan="2"><img src="/converse/images/boundaries/degree-top.gif" alt="" width="677" height="16" /></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="16" valign="top"><img src="/converse/images/boundaries/degree-left.gif" alt="" width="16" height="271" /></td>
<td>
<table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td><img src="/converse/images/links/what_university.gif" border="0" alt="what's it all about?" /></td>
<td><strong>What&#8217;s the difference between studying at school and at University?</strong> The main difference is the level of independence<br />
&#8211; and of responsibility. You&#8217;re usually studying just one or two subjects in detail  &#8211; and although there will be<br />
some classes like the ones you&#8217;re used to from school, you&#8217;ll probably have to do a lot of work on your own.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>It can also be a lot more work than school (or a lot less!). At Cambridge University, for example, students are asked to write an essay every week<br />
&#8211; which might mean reading 6 of Shakespeare&#8217;s plays and a couple of books about history, for example. You end up spending most of your time<br />
reading&#8230; so don&#8217;t choose to study English if you don&#8217;t enjoy reading.</p>
<p>One of the big differences you&#8217;ll notice is that you get much more say over what books you study. At most universities, you have the choice to do a long essay of your own research</p>
<p><strong>Find out much, much more about studying at University at<br />
<a title="(opens in new window)" href="http://www.uni4me.com/uni4me/index.cfm" target="_blank">Uni4Me</a><br />
and <a title="(opens in new window)" href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/radio1/onelife/education/index.shtml?exams#topics" target="_blank">OneLife</a>.</strong></p>
<table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td><img src="/converse/images/links/studying_university.gif" border="0" alt="what's it all about?" /></td>
<td>There are hundreds of English courses at Universities across the country.</p>
<p>It&#8217;s not just English that you can study, as well &#8211; for example,<br />
Cambridge and Manchester Universities both offer the opportunity to learn a modern<br />
langauge on the side, while at UEA (the University of East Anglia) you can study<br />
film as much as literature.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>To find out more about exactly what you might study at University, you&#8217;ll need to take a look at some of the University Prospectuses (which are also available online). They&#8217;ll describe in detail exactly what you would study and how. To find out just how many English courses you can study, take a look at the<br />
<a href="http://www.ucas.com/">UCAS (Universities and Colleges Admissions Service) website</a></p>
<p>Here are just a few of the country&#8217;s top English Departments to get you started.</p>
<p><a href="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/undergraduate/index.htm">Cambridge University</a></p>
<p><a href="http://www.apu.ac.uk/prospectus2003/subjects/subjects.phtml?sub=english">Anglia Polytechnic University</a></p>
<p><a href="http://www.art.man.ac.uk/ENGLISH/home.htm">Manchester University</a></p>
<p><a href="http://www.uea.ac.uk/eas/">University of East Anglia</a></p>
<p><a href="http://www.sussex.ac.uk/english/">Sussex University</a></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>


</div><!-- / Post -->						
	
	

		
			



</td>
<!-- / Main Column -->



</tr>
<!-- / Main Body -->
<tr>

<!-- Footer -->

</td>

</tr>
</table><!-- / layout -->

0;background:none}span.post-ratings{display:inline-block;width:auto;white-space:nowrap}div.navigation-top{border-top:solid 4px #eee;padding:8px 0}div.navigation-middle{margin:10px 0 20px 0;padding:8px <script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[



/* JQUERY */

jQuery(document).ready(function(){  

 
	/* For IE6 */
	if (jQuery.browser.msie && /MSIE 6\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent) && !/MSIE 7\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent) && !/MSIE 8\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent)) {

		/* Max-width for images in IE6 */		
		var centerwidth = jQuery("td#middle").width(); 
		
		/* Images without caption */
		jQuery(".post img").each(function() { 
			var maxwidth = centerwidth - 10 + 'px';
			var imgwidth = jQuery(this).width(); 
			var imgheight = jQuery(this).height(); 
			var newimgheight = (centerwidth / imgwidth * imgheight) + 'px';	
			if (imgwidth > centerwidth) { 
				jQuery(this).css({width: maxwidth}); 
				jQuery(this).css({height: newimgheight}); 
			}
		});
		
		/* Images with caption */
		jQuery("div.wp-caption").each(function() { 
			var captionwidth = jQuery(this).width(); 
			var maxcaptionwidth = centerwidth + 'px';
			var captionheight = jQuery(this).height();
			var captionimgwidth =  jQuery("div.wp-caption img").width();
			var captionimgheight =  jQuery("div.wp-caption img").height();
			if (captionwidth > centerwidth) { 
				jQuery(this).css({width: maxcaptionwidth}); 
				var newcaptionheight = (centerwidth / captionwidth * captionheight) + 'px';
				var newcaptionimgheight = (centerwidth / captionimgwidth * captionimgheight) + 'px';
				jQuery(this).css({height: newcaptionheight}); 
				jQuery("div.wp-caption img").css({height: newcaptionimgheight}); 
				}
		});
		
		/* sfhover for LI:HOVER support in IE6: */
		jQuery("ul li").
			hover( function() {
					jQuery(this).addClass("sfhover")
				}, 
				function() {
					jQuery(this).removeClass("sfhover")
				} 
			); 

	/* End IE6 */
	}
	
	jQuery(".post table tr").
		mouseover(function() {
			jQuery(this).addClass("over");
		}).
		mouseout(function() {
			jQuery(this).removeClass("over");
		});

	
	jQuery(".post table.zebra tr:even").
		addClass("alt");	

	
	jQuery("input.text, input.TextField, input.file, input.password, textarea").
		focus(function () {  
			jQuery(this).addClass("highlight"); 
		}).
		blur(function () { 
			jQuery(this).removeClass("highlight"); 
		})
	
	jQuery("input.inputblur").
		focus(function () {  
			jQuery(this).addClass("inputfocus"); 
		}).
		blur(function () { 
			jQuery(this).removeClass("inputfocus"); 
		})

		

	
	jQuery("input.button, input.Button").
		mouseover(function() {
			jQuery(this).addClass("buttonhover");
		}).
		mouseout(function() {
			jQuery(this).removeClass("buttonhover");
		});

	/* toggle "you can use these xhtml tags" */
	jQuery("a.xhtmltags").
		click(function(){ 
			jQuery("div.xhtml-tags").slideToggle(300); 
		});

	/* For the Tabbed Widgets plugin: */
	jQuery("ul.tw-nav-list").
		addClass("clearfix");

		
	
});

//]]>
</script>

jQuery(document).ready(function($) {
   $('.popup').click(function() {
     var NWin = window.open($(this).prop('href'), '', 'scrollbars=1,height=600,width=800');
     if (window.focus)
     {
       NWin.focus();
     }
     return false;
    });
});

<div class="post post-452 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-452">


<div class="post-headline">		<h1>Money at University</h1>
		</div>

<div class="post-bodycopy clearfix"><table border="0">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td colspan="2"><img src="/converse/images/boundaries/degree-top.gif" alt="" width="677" height="16" /></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="16" valign="top"><img src="/converse/images/boundaries/degree-left.gif" alt="" width="16" height="271" /></td>
<td>
<table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<p>Funding your studies can be a complicated business &#8211; depending on your parents&#8217; income, you may or may not have to pay a <strong>tuition fee</strong> for<br />
your studies. In the future, this may change, so that fees are higher but you will pay them back after university, once you&#8217;re<br />
earning more than a certain amount of money. While you&#8217;re studying, you will probably be awarded a <strong>student loan</strong> &#8211; which is a low-interest<br />
Government-funded loan to cover your living costs while you&#8217;re at University. This will be much cheaper than overdrafts and loans offered by banks and credit-card companies.<br />
Many Universities will also give their students bursaries, which don&#8217;t have to be paid back &#8211; for example, at <a href="http://www.newtontrust.cam.ac.uk/world/default.htm" target="_blank">Cambridge</a>,<br />
all students who don&#8217;t pay full tuition fees (i.e. their parents earn less than a certain amount) are awarded up to ¬£1000 a year, which doesn&#8217;t have to be paid back.</p>
<p><a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/radio1/onelife/education/index.shtml" target="_blank">Find out more</a> about paying for your studies.</p>
<table></table>
<table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td><img src="/converse/images/links/moneyworries.gif" border="0" alt="money worries?" /></td>
<td><img src="/converse/images/shim.gif" alt="" width="10" /></td>
<td><img src="/converse/images/links/quotes_right.gif" alt="" /><strong>I took a year out and spent the time working in a shop to earn money. At the same time, I did an NVQ in Business Administration at a local F.E. college &#8211; and the qualifications I got then helped me to find office work during the University holidays</strong><img src="/converse/images/links/quotes_right.gif" alt="" /></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>One of the best ways to fund your degree is by part-time work &#8211; which can then be valuable work experience after<br />
your degree when you&#8217;re looking for a job</p>
<p>You may already have a job &#8211; in a family business, for example &#8211; but if you&#8217;re looking for a new part-time job, try<br />
considering jobs using skills you&#8217;ve learnt from your English studies.</p>
<p>As an English student, you&#8217;ll be good at writing and original research: if you have typing and word processing skills,<br />
you could try looking for summer jobs in an office or as a secretary.<br />
If you&#8217;ve used a computer at school or at home, make sure you add this to your CV. If you&#8217;re good with computers,<br />
you could learn how to create web pages. This type of skill can look really impressive on your CV.</p>
<p>The National Union of Students&#8217; <a href="http://www.activate.co.uk/">Job website</a> is full of jobs for both<br />
current students.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>


</div><!-- / Post -->						
	
	

		
			



</td>
<!-- / Main Column -->



</tr>
<!-- / Main Body -->

content:".";display:block;height:0;clear:both;visibility:hidden}.clearfix{min-width:0;display:inline-block;display:block}* html .clearfix{height:1%;}.clearboth{clear:both;height:1%;font-size:1%;line-height:1%;display:block;padding:0;margin:0}td#header{padding-bottom:15px;}td#middle{padding:0}div.searchbox-form{margin:5px 0 15px 5px}div#menu1 ul.rMenu{background:transparent;border:none}div#imagecontainer{border-top:solid 5px #333;border-bottom:solid 5px #333;}div.widget ul li{padding:1px 5px 1px 12px !important;background:url('http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/converse/wp-content/themes/conversetheme/images/bullets/round-gray.gif') no-repeat 0 7px}ul.rMenu-hor ul,ul.rMenu-hRight ul{margin-top:0px;}ul.rMenu-hor li{margin-bottom:0px;margin-top:0px;margin-left:0px;}ul.rMenu-hor{padding-left:0px;}ul.rMenu-ver li{margin-top:0xp;}div#menu1 ul.rMenu li a,div#menu2 ul.rMenu li ul.rMenu li li,div#menu1 ul.rMenu li li a{-webkit-border-top-left-radius:0;-webkit-border-top-right-radius:0;-moz-border-radius-topleft:0;-moz-border-radius-topright:0;border-top-left-radius:0;border-top-right-radius:0}</style>
<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[



/* JQUERY */

jQuery(document).ready(function(){  

 
	/* For IE6 */
	if (jQuery.browser.msie && /MSIE 6\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent) && !/MSIE 7\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent) && !/MSIE 8\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent)) {

		/* Max-width for images in IE6 */		
		var centerwidth = jQuery("td#middle").width(); 
		
		/* Images without caption */
		jQuery(".post img").each(function() { 
			var maxwidth = centerwidth - 10 + 'px';
			var imgwidth = jQuery(this).width(); 
			var imgheight = jQuery(this).height(); 
			var newimgheight = (centerwidth / imgwidth * imgheight) + 'px';	
			if (imgwidth > centerwidth) { 
				jQuery(this).css({width: maxwidth}); 
				jQuery(this).css({height: newimgheight}); 
			}
		});
		
		/* Images with caption */
		jQuery("div.wp-caption").each(function() { 
			var captionwidth = jQuery(this).width(); 
			var maxcaptionwidth = centerwidth + 'px';
			var captionheight = jQuery(this).height();
			var captionimgwidth =  jQuery("div.wp-caption img").width();
			var captionimgheight =  jQuery("div.wp-caption img").height();
			if (captionwidth > centerwidth) { 
				jQuery(this).css({width: maxcaptionwidth}); 
				var newcaptionheight = (centerwidth / captionwidth * captionheight) + 'px';
				var newcaptionimgheight = (centerwidth / captionimgwidth * captionimgheight) + 'px';
				jQuery(this).css({height: newcaptionheight}); 
				jQuery("div.wp-caption img").css({height: newcaptionimgheight}); 
				}
		});
		
		/* sfhover for LI:HOVER support in IE6: */
		jQuery("ul li").
			hover( function() {
					jQuery(this).addClass("sfhover")
				}, 
				function() {
					jQuery(this).removeClass("sfhover")
				} 
			); 

	/* End IE6 */
	}
	
	jQuery(".post table tr").
		mouseover(function() {
			jQuery(this).addClass("over");
		}).
		mouseout(function() {
			jQuery(this).removeClass("over");
		});

	
	jQuery(".post table.zebra tr:even").
		addClass("alt");	

	
	jQuery("input.text, input.TextField, input.file, input.password, textarea").
		focus(function () {  
			jQuery(this).addClass("highlight"); 
		}).
		blur(function () { 
			jQuery(this).removeClass("highlight"); 
		})
	
	jQuery("input.inputblur").
		focus(function () {  
			jQuery(this).addClass("inputfocus"); 
		}).
		blur(function () { 
			jQuery(this).removeClass("inputfocus"); 
		})

		

	
	jQuery("input.button, input.Button").
		mouseover(function() {
			jQuery(this).addClass("buttonhover");
		}).
		mouseout(function() {
			jQuery(this).removeClass("buttonhover");
		});

	/* toggle "you can use these xhtml tags" */
	jQuery("a.xhtmltags").
		click(function(){ 
			jQuery("div.xhtml-tags").slideToggle(300); 
		});

	/* For the Tabbed Widgets plugin: */
	jQuery("ul.tw-nav-list").
		addClass("clearfix");

		
	
});

//]]>
</script>

<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery(document).ready(function($) {
   $('.popup').click(function() {
     var NWin = window.open($(this).prop('href'), '', 'scrollbars=1,height=600,width=800');
     if (window.focus)
     {
       NWin.focus();
     }
     return false;
    });
});
</script>

<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[



/* JQUERY */

jQuery(document).ready(function(){  

 
	/* For IE6 */
	if (jQuery.browser.msie && /MSIE 6\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent) && !/MSIE 7\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent) && !/MSIE 8\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent)) {

		/* Max-width for images in IE6 */		
		var centerwidth = jQuery("td#middle").width(); 
		
		/* Images without caption */
		jQuery(".post img").each(function() { 
			var maxwidth = centerwidth - 10 + 'px';
			var imgwidth = jQuery(this).width(); 
			var imgheight = jQuery(this).height(); 
			var newimgheight = (centerwidth / imgwidth * imgheight) + 'px';	
			if (imgwidth > centerwidth) { 
				jQuery(this).css({width: maxwidth}); 
				jQuery(this).css({height: newimgheight}); 
			}
		});
		
		/* Images with caption */
		jQuery("div.wp-caption").each(function() { 
			var captionwidth = jQuery(this).width(); 
			var maxcaptionwidth = centerwidth + 'px';
			var captionheight = jQuery(this).height();
			var captionimgwidth =  jQuery("div.wp-caption img").width();
			var captionimgheight =  jQuery("div.wp-caption img").height();
			if (captionwidth > centerwidth) { 
				jQuery(this).css({width: maxcaptionwidth}); 
				var newcaptionheight = (centerwidth / captionwidth * captionheight) + 'px';
				var newcaptionimgheight = (centerwidth / captionimgwidth * captionimgheight) + 'px';
				jQuery(this).css({height: newcaptionheight}); 
				jQuery("div.wp-caption img").css({height: newcaptionimgheight}); 
				}
		});
		
		/* sfhover for LI:HOVER support in IE6: */
		jQuery("ul li").
			hover( function() {
					jQuery(this).addClass("sfhover")
				}, 
				function() {
					jQuery(this).removeClass("sfhover")
				} 
			); 

	/* End IE6 */
	}
	
	jQuery(".post table tr").
		mouseover(function() {
			jQuery(this).addClass("over");
		}).
		mouseout(function() {
			jQuery(this).removeClass("over");
		});

	
	jQuery(".post table.zebra tr:even").
		addClass("alt");	

	
	jQuery("input.text, input.TextField, input.file, input.password, textarea").
		focus(function () {  
			jQuery(this).addClass("highlight"); 
		}).
		blur(function () { 
			jQuery(this).removeClass("highlight"); 
		})
	
	jQuery("input.inputblur").
		focus(function () {  
			jQuery(this).addClass("inputfocus"); 
		}).
		blur(function () { 
			jQuery(this).removeClass("inputfocus"); 
		})

		

	
	jQuery("input.button, input.Button").
		mouseover(function() {
			jQuery(this).addClass("buttonhover");
		}).
		mouseout(function() {
			jQuery(this).removeClass("buttonhover");
		});

	/* toggle "you can use these xhtml tags" */
	jQuery("a.xhtmltags").
		click(function(){ 
			jQuery("div.xhtml-tags").slideToggle(300); 
		});

	/* For the Tabbed Widgets plugin: */
	jQuery("ul.tw-nav-list").
		addClass("clearfix");

		
	
});

//]]>
</script>
<!--[if IE 6]>
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/converse/wp-content/themes/conversetheme/js/DD_roundies.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">DD_roundies.addRule('a.posts-icon, a.comments-icon, a.email-icon, img.logo');</script>
<![endif]-->
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery(document).ready(function($) {
   $('.popup').click(function() {
     var NWin = window.open($(this).prop('href'), '', 'scrollbars=1,height=600,width=800');
     if (window.focus)
     {
       NWin.focus();
     }
     return false;
    });
});
</script>

<div class="post post-221 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-221">


<div class="post-headline">		<h1>Past Seminars</h1>
		</div>

<div class="post-bodycopy clearfix"><table border="0">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td colspan="2"><img src="/converse/images/boundaries/seminars-top.gif" alt="" width="677" height="16" /></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="16" valign="top"><img src="/converse/images/boundaries/seminars-left.gif" alt="" width="16" height="271" /></td>
<td>
<table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<table width="650">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td valign="top">
<table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td><!--img src="/converse/images/sections/seminars.gif" align="right"/--></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Sorry, our on-line seminars are no longer taking place. You may be interested in having a look at our past seminars, though.</p>
<p><strong>AS and A2 seminars</strong></p>
<p><a class="display" href="?page_id=228"><strong>&#8220;A new view on a new world&#8221;</strong><br />
&#8211; a seminar focusing on Andrew Marvell (1621-1678), comparing his poem &#8216;Bermudas&#8217; with contemporary maps of the Bermuda Islands. </a></p>
<p><a class="display" href="?page_id=246"><strong>&#8220;Playing with form&#8221;</strong><br />
&#8211; a seminar looking at two villanelles by Elizabeth Bishop and Dylan Thomas </a></p>
<p><a class="display" href="?page_id=268"><strong>&#8220;Inspiration and recollection&#8221;</strong><br />
&#8211; a seminar which looks in detail at Edward Thomas&#8217; poem &#8216;Rain&#8217;, considering how he reworks a previous prose passage in a new context.</a></p>
<p><a class="display" href="?page_id=289"><strong>&#8220;The Indian War Poet?&#8221;</strong><br />
&#8211; a seminar looking at the relationship between Nobel prize winner Rabindranath Tagore and the British First World War poets.</a></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>


</div><!-- / Post -->						
	
	

		
			



</td>
<!-- / Main Column -->



</tr>
<!-- / Main Body -->
