<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[



/* JQUERY */

jQuery(document).ready(function(){  

 
	/* For IE6 */
	if (jQuery.browser.msie && /MSIE 6\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent) && !/MSIE 7\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent) && !/MSIE 8\.0/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent)) {

		/* Max-width for images in IE6 */		
		var centerwidth = jQuery("td#middle").width(); 
		
		/* Images without caption */
		jQuery(".post img").each(function() { 
			var maxwidth = centerwidth - 10 + 'px';
			var imgwidth = jQuery(this).width(); 
			var imgheight = jQuery(this).height(); 
			var newimgheight = (centerwidth / imgwidth * imgheight) + 'px';	
			if (imgwidth > centerwidth) { 
				jQuery(this).css({width: maxwidth}); 
				jQuery(this).css({height: newimgheight}); 
			}
		});
		
		/* Images with caption */
		jQuery("div.wp-caption").each(function() { 
			var captionwidth = jQuery(this).width(); 
			var maxcaptionwidth = centerwidth + 'px';
			var captionheight = jQuery(this).height();
			var captionimgwidth =  jQuery("div.wp-caption img").width();
			var captionimgheight =  jQuery("div.wp-caption img").height();
			if (captionwidth > centerwidth) { 
				jQuery(this).css({width: maxcaptionwidth}); 
				var newcaptionheight = (centerwidth / captionwidth * captionheight) + 'px';
				var newcaptionimgheight = (centerwidth / captionimgwidth * captionimgheight) + 'px';
				jQuery(this).css({height: newcaptionheight}); 
				jQuery("div.wp-caption img").css({height: newcaptionimgheight}); 
				}
		});
		
		/* sfhover for LI:HOVER support in IE6: */
		jQuery("ul li").
			hover( function() {
					jQuery(this).addClass("sfhover")
				}, 
				function() {
					jQuery(this).removeClass("sfhover")
				} 
			); 

	/* End IE6 */
	}
	
	jQuery(".post table tr").
		mouseover(function() {
			jQuery(this).addClass("over");
		}).
		mouseout(function() {
			jQuery(this).removeClass("over");
		});

	
	jQuery(".post table.zebra tr:even").
		addClass("alt");	

	
	jQuery("input.text, input.TextField, input.file, input.password, textarea").
		focus(function () {  
			jQuery(this).addClass("highlight"); 
		}).
		blur(function () { 
			jQuery(this).removeClass("highlight"); 
		})
	
	jQuery("input.inputblur").
		focus(function () {  
			jQuery(this).addClass("inputfocus"); 
		}).
		blur(function () { 
			jQuery(this).removeClass("inputfocus"); 
		})

		

	
	jQuery("input.button, input.Button").
		mouseover(function() {
			jQuery(this).addClass("buttonhover");
		}).
		mouseout(function() {
			jQuery(this).removeClass("buttonhover");
		});

	/* toggle "you can use these xhtml tags" */
	jQuery("a.xhtmltags").
		click(function(){ 
			jQuery("div.xhtml-tags").slideToggle(300); 
		});

	/* For the Tabbed Widgets plugin: */
	jQuery("ul.tw-nav-list").
		addClass("clearfix");

		
	
});

//]]>
</script>
<!--[if IE 6]>
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/converse/wp-content/themes/conversetheme/js/DD_roundies.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">DD_roundies.addRule('a.posts-icon, a.comments-icon, a.email-icon, img.logo');</script>
<![endif]-->
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery(document).ready(function($) {
   $('.popup').click(function() {
     var NWin = window.open($(this).prop('href'), '', 'scrollbars=1,height=600,width=800');
     if (window.focus)
     {
       NWin.focus();
     }
     return false;
    });
});
</script>

		<td id="middle">

	

		
		 

		
<div class="post post-307 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-307">


<div class="post-headline">		<h1>The Tutors</h1>
		</div>

<div class="post-bodycopy clearfix"><table border="0">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td colspan="2"><img src="/converse/images/boundaries/seminars-top.gif" alt="" width="677" height="16" /></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="16" valign="top"><img src="/converse/images/boundaries/seminars-left.gif" alt="" width="16" height="271" /></td>
<td>
<table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<table></table>
<table width="650">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td valign="top">
<table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td><!--img src="/converse/images/sections/seminars.gif" align="right"/--></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<h3>About our seminar tutors</h3>
<p><strong>Rachel Warrington</strong></p>
<p>Rachel says, &#8220;I did a BA (3 year degree) in English at Cambridge. Over the three years I studied English literature from all the time periods between Chaucer in the 1300s and modern poetry and novels. I liked it so much that I came back for more! Last year I did an &#8216;MPhil&#8217;, a one year postgraduate course, in Renaissance Literature: this meant that I spent a whole year on literature written between about 1500 and 1700. I also learnt to read manuscripts &#8211; texts written by hand in really strange Renaissance handwriting &#8211; and did some of my own research, on the poet Sir Thomas Wyatt and his use of language.&#8221;</p>
<p>Next year Rachel will be training to become an English teacher. But until then, as well as teaching online seminars, Rachel is a chef at a London restaurant!</p>
<p><strong>Sarah James</strong></p>
<p>I came to Cambridge as a mature student, having spent several years working in corporate administration and contracts management. I wanted to study English because I loved reading more than anything else &#8211; and once I started at Cambridge, I knew it was the right choice! After my undergraduate degree I spent a year as a graduate student at Cornell University in the USA, before coming back to Cambridge to do an MPhil in Medieval Literature. I then spent a further three years doing a PhD, researching religious texts written in the fifteenth century. I now split my time between teaching medieval literature and language to undergraduates, and working for this project.</p>
<p><strong>Harriet Truscott</strong></p>
<p>Like Rachel, Harriet Truscott did a BA Undergraduate degree and then an M.Phil in English Literature at Cambridge. Harriet specialised in literature from the Restoration period (1660-1700), which she enjoys because it is mostly very silly. Harriet now runs the English Faculty&#8217;s outreach project, which she loves as it means she can spend all day talking about books.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>


</div><!-- / Post -->						
	
	

		
			



</td>
<!-- / Main Column -->



</tr>

		<div class="wrap clearfix page-sub-title recessed-sub-title">
			<div class="column12">
				<div class="content-container">
				<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="SectionTitle" -->
                	<p class="sub-title">Graduate Research Seminars</p>
				<!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
   				</div>
			</div>
		</div>
	</div>


		<div class="row content recessed-content">
			<div class="wrap clearfix">
				<div class="column9  main-content" id="content">
					<div class="content-container">
                    <!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="PageTitle" -->
						<h1></h1>
                        <!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
	<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="content" -->
    <br clear="all" />
<hr class="teaser-divider" />
<br clear="all" />

<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding">	                
	    <div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img">
			<a href="/seminars/amlit/index.htm" class="teaser-img-link">
			<img class="scale-with-grid" src="images/american.jpg" alt="American Literature" /></a>
		</div>
		<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
			<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="/seminars/amlit/index.htm">American</a></h3>
			<p>A series of reading groups, discussions and academic papers organised by graduate students of American Literature. All welcome.</p>
			<a class="primary-cta" href="amlit/index.htm">Read more</a>
            <br />&nbsp;
		
		</div>
	</div>
</div>

<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding">
		<div class="teaser vertical-teaser">
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img">
   				<a href="rom.htm" class="teaser-img-link">
				<img class="scale-with-grid" src="images/eighteenth.jpg" alt="Eighteenth-Century and Romantic Studies" /></a>
			</div>
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
				<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="rom.htm">18th Century and Romatic Literature</a></h3>
				<p>The Eighteenth-Century and Romantic Studies Seminar is a research forum for those interested in the literature and culture of the period 1660 to 1830. It welcomes graduate students and teaching and research staff both from around Cambridge University (be that the English Faculty or other departments) and from beyond. Students and academics of all kinds, from postdoctoral researchers to professors, present papers for round-table discussion over drinks.</p>
				<a class="primary-cta" href="rom.htm">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;
			</div>
        </div>
	</div>
</div>

<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding sub-column-left-border">
		<div class="teaser vertical-teaser">      
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img">
				<a href="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/cmt/?cat=6" class="teaser-img-link">
                <img class="scale-with-grid" src="images/material-texts.jpg" alt="The History of Material Texts" /></a>
			</div>
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
				<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/cmt/?cat=6">The History of Material Texts</a></h3>
				<p>The seminar in the history of material texts is a forum for research across disciplines and across periods, for all those interested in the history of the book, bibliography, histories and theories of reading, and the intersections between intellectual history and material culture, including the creation, production, publication, distribution, reception, transmission, editing and subsequent history of texts as material objects in manuscript, print, digital media or other forms.</p>         
				<a class="primary-cta" href="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/cmt/?cat=6">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;
			</div>	                
		</div>
	</div>
</div>


<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding sub-column-left-border">
    	<div class="teaser vertical-teaser">
	        
			      
		</div>
	</div>
</div>

<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding sub-column-left-border">
    	<div class="teaser vertical-teaser">
	        <div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img"></div>
			       
		</div>
	</div>
</div>

&nbsp;<br />
<br clear="all" />
<hr class="teaser-divider" />
<br clear="all" />





&nbsp;<br />
<br clear="all" />
<hr class="teaser-divider" />
<br clear="all" />

<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding">
		<div class="teaser vertical-teaser">
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img">
				<a href="med.htm" class="teaser-img-link">
				<img class="scale-with-grid" src="images/medieval.jpg" alt="BL Harley 2278, f. 6 detail" /></a>
			</div>
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
				<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="med.htm">Medieval</a></h3>
				<p>&nbsp;</p>
				<a class="primary-cta" href="med.htm">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;
			</div>	    
        </div>
	</div>
</div>

<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding sub-column-left-border">
		<div class="teaser vertical-teaser">      
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img">
				<a href="nineteenth.htm" class="teaser-img-link">
				<img class="scale-with-grid" src="images/nineteenth.jpg" alt="Nineteenth Century" /></a>
			</div>
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
				<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="nineteenth.htm">Nineteenth Century</a></h3>
				<p>&nbsp;</p>
				<a class="primary-cta" href="nineteenth.htm">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;
			</div>	              
		</div>
	</div>
</div>

<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding sub-column-left-border">
		<div class="teaser vertical-teaser">      
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img"><img class="scale-with-grid" src="images/material-texts.jpg" alt="The History of Material Texts" /></div>
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
				<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="https://www.hist.cam.ac.uk/seminars/early-modern-interdisciplinary">Interdisciplinary Early Modern Graduate Seminar</a></h3>
				<p>&nbsp;</p>
				<a class="primary-cta" href="https://www.hist.cam.ac.uk/seminars/early-modern-interdisciplinary">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;
			</div>	       
		</div>
	</div>
</div>

&nbsp;<br />
<br clear="all" />
<hr class="teaser-divider" />
<br clear="all" />

<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding sub-column-left-border">
		<div class="teaser vertical-teaser">      
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img">
				<a href="queercultures.html" class="teaser-img-link">
				<img class="scale-with-grid" src="images/queercultures.jpg" alt="Queer Cultures Seminar" /></a>
			</div>
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
				<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="queercultures.html">Queer Cultures</a></h3>
				<p>Broadly historicist in approach, the Queer Cultures Research Seminar is intended to complement the recently established Cambridge Queer Theory Reading Group, providing an interdisciplinary forum for discussion between visiting academics, faculty members and graduate students across the arts and humanities. The seminar is dedicated to broadening the remit of contemporary queer studies, aiming to attract those interested in sexuality and gender studies, but also those with a particular interest in deviant, covert and  criminal cultures, in the aesthetics of transgression, in illicit discourses, and, more broadly, in what Christopher Isherwood once termed ‘the market value of the Odd.’</p>
				<a class="primary-cta" href="queercultures.html">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;
			</div>	              
		</div>
	</div>
</div>

<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding sub-column-left-border">
		<div class="teaser vertical-teaser">      
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img">
				<a href="./rgs/" class="teaser-img-link">
				<img class="scale-with-grid" src="../research/images/research-groups/renaissance.jpg" alt="Renaissance Research Group" /></a>
			</div>
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
				<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="./rgs/">Renaissance</a></h3>
				<p>&nbsp;</p>
				<a class="primary-cta" href="./rgs/">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;
			</div>	       
		</div>
	</div>
</div>
<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding">
		<div class="teaser vertical-teaser">
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img">
				<a href="http://www.mml.cam.ac.uk/film/research/seminars" class="teaser-img-link">
				<img class="scale-with-grid" src="images/screen-media.jpg" alt="Screen Media" /></a>
			</div>
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
				<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="http://www.mml.cam.ac.uk/film/research/seminars">Screen Media</a></h3>
				<p>&nbsp;</p>
				<a class="primary-cta" href="http://www.mml.cam.ac.uk/film/research/seminars">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;
			</div>	    
        </div>
	</div>
</div>

&nbsp;<br />
<br clear="all" />
<hr class="teaser-divider" />
<br clear="all" />



<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding sub-column-left-border">
		<div class="teaser vertical-teaser">      
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img">
				<a href="./song/" class="teaser-img-link">
				<img class="scale-with-grid" src="images/song-soundwavesquare.jpg" alt="Song Seminar" /></a>
			</div>
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
				<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="./song/">Song Seminar</a></h3>
				<p>Our regular lunchtime seminar fosters cross-disciplinary conversations about songs – their forms, functions, relations, histories – and about the poets, composers, songwriters, and performers who make them. We consider songs of all periods and traditions, and try to feature live performances when we can. </p>
				<a class="primary-cta" href="./song/">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;
			</div>	       
		</div>
	</div>
</div>

<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding sub-column-left-border">
		<div class="teaser vertical-teaser">      
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img">
				<a href="TheoryCC.htm" class="teaser-img-link">
				<img class="scale-with-grid" src="images/lit-theory.jpg" alt="Theory, Criticism, and Culture" /></a>
			</div>
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
				<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="TheoryCC.htm">Theory, Criticism, and Culture</a></h3>
				<p>&nbsp;</p>
				<a class="primary-cta" href="TheoryCC.htm">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;
			</div>
		</div>
	</div>
</div>

<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding">
		<div class="teaser vertical-teaser">
		<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img">
				<a href="twentieth.htm" class="teaser-img-link">
				<img class="scale-with-grid" src="images/twentieth.jpg" alt="Twentieth Century and Contemporary Literature" /></a>
			</div>
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
				<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="twentieth.htm">Twentieth Century and Contemporary Literature</a></h3>
				<p>The Twentieth Century and Contemporary Graduate Seminar is a forum for scholars to present research on aspects of literature and culture in this century and last. While the seminar serves as a testing ground for new ideas that push against the expectations of period and discipline, it is also home to our lively community of postgraduate and postdoctoral researchers, providing a valuable resource within the Faculty. </p>
				<a class="primary-cta" href="twentieth.htm">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;
			</div>	    
        </div>
	</div>
</div>

<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding sub-column-left-border">
		<div class="teaser vertical-teaser">      
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img">
				<a href="parl.htm" class="teaser-img-link">
				<img class="scale-with-grid" src="images/parl.jpg"alt="Parl" /></a>
			</div>
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
				<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="./song/">Postcolonial and Related Literatures</a></h3>
								<a class="primary-cta" href="parl.htm">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;
			</div>	       
		</div>
	</div>
</div>

				    <div class="heading-container">
					<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="RelatedLinksTitle" -->							
                       <h2> Related Links</h2>

    <li><a href="/research/collaborative.htm">Collaborative Research Projects</a></li>
    <li><a href="/research/groups.htm">Faculty Research Groups</a></li>
    <li><a href="/seminars/index.htm">Graduate Research Seminars</a>
	<ul style="margin-left:1em; text-indent:hanging;">
	    <li style="padding:0;"><a href="/seminars/amlit/index.htm">American</a></li>

	    <li style="padding:0;"><a href="/seminars/nineteenth.htm">Nineteenth-Century</a></li>	
	    <li style="padding:0;"><a href="https://www.hist.cam.ac.uk/seminars/early-modern-interdisciplinary">Interdisciplinary Early Modern </a></li>
	    <li style="padding:0;"><a href="parl.htm">Postcolonial and Related Literatures</a></li>	
	    <li style="padding:0;"><a href="/seminars/queercultures.html">Queer Cultures</a></li>
    	<li style="padding:0;"><a href="/seminars/rgs/index.htm">Renaissance</a></li>
    	<li style="padding:0;"><a href="http://www.mml.cam.ac.uk/film/research/seminars">Screen Media </a><img src="/images/interface/icon-external-link.png" width="9" height="9" /></li>
    	<li style="padding:0;"><a href="./song/">Song</a> </li>
    	<li style="padding:0;"><a href="TheoryCC.htm">Theory, Criticism, and Culture</a></li>
    	<li style="padding:0;"><a href="/seminars/twentieth.htm">Twentieth Century and Contemporary Literature</a></li>
   	  </ul>
    </li>
    <li>Other Research Groups</li>
		<ul style="margin-left:1em; text-indent:hanging;">
  			<li style="padding:0;"><a href="http://www.marginalia.co.uk/">The Medieval Reading Group</a> <img src="/images/interface/icon-external-link.png" width="9" height="9" /></li>
  		</ul>
    </li>
  <li><a href="/research/features/index.htm">Research Features</a></li>
    <li><a href="/research/intranet/index.htm">Research Funding</a> <span style="font-size:80%;">(Raven Needed)</span></li>
    <li><a href="/research/intranet/access.htm">Open Access</a> <span style="font-size:80%;">(Raven Needed)</span></li>
    <li><a href="/research/intranet/impact/">Research Impact</a> <span style="font-size:80%;">(Raven Needed)</span></li>
</ul>
<p>&nbsp;</p>

#w2b-StoTop {-moz-border-radius: 5px;-webkit-border-radius: 5px;border-radius: 5px; width:100px;background-color: #EEEEEE;background-color: rgba(238, 238, 238, 0.6);filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.gradient(startColorStr='#99EEEEEE',EndColorStr='#99EEEEEE');text-align:center;padding:5px;position:fixed;bottom:10px;right:10px;cursor:pointer;color:#444;text-decoration:none;border:1px solid #C9C9C9;}
</style>
<script type='text/javascript'>
    $(function() {
        $.fn.scrollToTop = function() {
            $(this).hide().removeAttr("href");
            if ($(window).scrollTop() != "0") {
                $(this).fadeIn("slow")
            }
            var scrollDiv = $(this);
            $(window).scroll(function() {
                if ($(window).scrollTop() == "0") {
                    $(scrollDiv).fadeOut("slow")
                } else {
                    $(scrollDiv).fadeIn("slow")
                }
            });
            $(this).click(function() {
                $("html, body").animate({
                    scrollTop: 0
                }, "slow")
            })
        }
    });
    $(function() {
        $("#w2b-StoTop").scrollToTop();
    });
</script>

	<ul class="unstyled-list local-dropdown-menu">
		<li><a href="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/troilus/">Troilus &amp; Criseyde: Translation &amp; Commentary</a></li>
        <li><a href="https://cudl.lib.cam.ac.uk/collections/tennyson">The Tennysons Archive</a></li>
        <li><a href="http://scriptorium.english.cam.ac.uk/">Scriptorium</a></li>
		<li><a href="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/cambridgeauthors/">Cambridge Authors</a></li>
	  <li><a href="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/classroom/index.htm">The Virtual Classroom</a></li>
		<li><a href="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/ceres/ehoc/">English Handwriting Online</a></li>
		<li><a href="https://www.transkills.admin.cam.ac.uk/resources/english/english-cambridge">Transkills for English</a></li>
	</ul>    
</li>
<li class=""><a class="" href="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/intranets.htm">Intranets</a>
	<ul class="unstyled-list local-dropdown-menu">
	  	<li><a href="https://www.english.cam.ac.uk/students/">Students</a></li>
		<li><a href="https://www.english.cam.ac.uk/directors/">Directors of Studies</a></li>
		<li><a href="https://www.english.cam.ac.uk/officers/">Teaching Officers &amp; Research Fellows</a></li>
		<li><a href="https://www.english.cam.ac.uk/computing/">Faculty Computing</a></li>
	</ul>
</li>
<li><a class="" href="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/news/">News</a></li>
</ul>
			<!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
    		<!-- Menu ends -->
			</div>
		</div>



		<div class="wrap clearfix page-sub-title recessed-sub-title">
			<div class="column12">
				<div class="content-container">
				<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="SectionTitle" -->
				<p class="sub-title">Research Seminars</p>
				<!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
   				</div>
			</div>
		</div>
	</div>


		<div class="row content recessed-content">
			<div class="wrap clearfix">
				<div class="column9  main-content" id="content">
					<div class="content-container">
                    <!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="PageTitle" -->
                    <h1>Poetics Before Modernity</h1>
					<!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
	<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="content" -->

<div class="carousel-container">
	<ul class="unstyled-list slides">
		<li class="slide column12">
			<div class="image-container">
				<img alt="Poetics Before Modernity" title=""  src="../research/images/gallery/poetics-modernity.jpg" class="scale-with-grid"  style="padding:1.2em 0;" />
			</div>
		</li>
	</ul>
</div>
&nbsp;<br />
<p><em>Poetics before Modernity</em> brings together leading classicists, medievalists, and Renaissance scholars to present new work on Western literary theory from antiquity to 1700.</p>
<p>Unless otherwise noted, meetings will take place on <strong>Tuesdays</strong> at <strong>5.15pm</strong> in the <strong>Old Combination Room at Trinity College</strong>. Refreshments will be served.</p>

<p>Convenors: Vladimir Brljak (vb276@cam.ac.uk) and Micha Lazarus (mdsl3@cam.ac.uk). </p>

<p>Please sign up to the mailing list <a href="https://lists.cam.ac.uk/mailman/listinfo/english-poetics">here</a>.</p>
<!--
<h2 class="center" style="padding-top:1.5em;">Next Seminar</h2>
<div id="next">-->
<!-- put text here -->
<!--</div>-->

<h2 style="padding-top:1.5em;">Full Programme: 2016-2017</h2>
<div class="splitcontentleft">
	<p><strong>MICHAELMAS 2016  </strong></p>
	<p>Tuesday 25 Oct. - "<a href="./poetics/index.html#most">Allegory and Etymology</a>"<br/>Glenn Most (Scuola Normale Superiore, Pisa)  </p>
	<p>Thursday 24 Nov. - &quot;<a href="./poetics/index.html#copeland">An Emotional Anthology of Style</a>&quot;<br/>
	  Rita Copeland (University of Pennsylvania)  </p>
	<p><strong>LENT 2017  </strong></p>
	<p>Tuesday 24 Jan.
	 - &quot;<a href="./poetics/index.html#burrow">Practical Criticism, Elizabethan Style</a>&quot;<br/> Colin Burrow (University of Oxford)</p>
	<p> Tuesday 7 Feb. - <a href="./poetics/index.html#halliwell">Inside and Outside the Mind: The Greek Poetics of Inspiration</a><br/> Stephen Halliwell (University of St Andrews)  </p>
	<p>Tuesday 21 Feb.
	  - <a href="./poetics/index.html#whitman">The Second Greatest Story Ever Told</a><br/> Jon Whitman (The Hebrew University of Jerusalem)  </p>
	<p>Tuesday 7 Mar. 
	  <a href="./poetics/index.html#alexander">Lyric Poetics?</a><br/>Gavin Alexander (University of Cambridge)  </p>
</div>
<div class="splitcontentright">
	<p><strong>EASTER 2017  </strong></p>
	<p>Tuesday 2 May. - <a href="./poetics/index.html#greene">Metametrica: Juan Caramuel's Baroque Poetics</a><br/>
	  Roland Greene (Stanford University)  </p>
	<p>Tuesday 16 May. - <a href="./poetics/index.html#struck">Hermeneutic Fields in Ancient Poetics</a><br/>
	  Peter Struck (University of Pennsylvania)  </p>
	<p>Tuesday 30 May. - <a href="./poetics/index.htm#zeeman">Personification and Alienation: The Case of Deguileville</a><br/>
	  Nicolette Zeeman (University of Cambridge)  </p>
	<p>Tuesday 13 Jun.
	  - <a href="./poetics/index.html#eden">The Early Modern Rhetoric of Plato's Poetics</a><br/>Kathy Eden (Columbia University)  </p>
</div>
<br clear="all" />
	<!-- InstanceEndEditable -->

						
				  </div> <!-- end content container -->

#w2b-StoTop {-moz-border-radius: 5px;-webkit-border-radius: 5px;border-radius: 5px; width:100px;background-color: #EEEEEE;background-color: rgba(238, 238, 238, 0.6);filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.gradient(startColorStr='#99EEEEEE',EndColorStr='#99EEEEEE');text-align:center;padding:5px;position:fixed;bottom:10px;right:10px;cursor:pointer;color:#444;text-decoration:none;border:1px solid #C9C9C9;}

<script type='text/javascript'>
    $(function() {
        $.fn.scrollToTop = function() {
            $(this).hide().removeAttr("href");
            if ($(window).scrollTop() != "0") {
                $(this).fadeIn("slow")
            }
            var scrollDiv = $(this);
            $(window).scroll(function() {
                if ($(window).scrollTop() == "0") {
                    $(scrollDiv).fadeOut("slow")
                } else {
                    $(scrollDiv).fadeIn("slow")
                }
            });
            $(this).click(function() {
                $("html, body").animate({
                    scrollTop: 0
                }, "slow")
            })
        }
    });
    $(function() {
        $("#w2b-StoTop").scrollToTop();
    });
</script>

				<div class="column9  main-content" id="content">
					<div class="content-container">
                    <!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="PageTitle" -->
						<h1 style="display:inline;">American Literature Research Seminar</h1>
                        <!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
	<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="content" -->
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p align="center"><img border="0" src="AmLitG2.jpg" width="231" height="146" alt="Satellite picture of USA from space" /></p>
<p align="center"><strong>Michaelmas Term 2017</strong></p>
<p align="center">&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>12 October</strong> 4.30-6.00	SR24
(in collaboration with Twentieth Century seminar) </p>
<p>Prof Joy Porter (University of Hull) “The Native American Indian Poet of the First World War: Trauma, Modernity and the Bloomsbury/Garsington Set”.  </p>
<p><strong>26 October</strong> 4.30-6.00	SR24
  Prof David Trotter (University of Cambridge), “From Kitty Hawk to Cybernetics: 
  technique and technology in the literature of flight” </p>
<p><strong>29 November</strong> 4.30-6.00	G-R05	
  Prof Joseph Tabbi (University of Illinois, Chicago), title to be announced. </p>
<p><a href="Past-programmes.htm">Previous Programmes</a> </strong></p>
</p>
<hr />
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<!-- InstanceEndEditable -->

						
				  </div> <!-- end content container -->
				</div> <!-- end column9 maincontent -->

				  <div class="content-container">
				    <div class="heading-container">
					<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="RelatedLinksTitle" -->							
                       <h2>Graduate Seminars</h2>
					   <!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
				    </div><!-- end heading container -->

#w2b-StoTop {-moz-border-radius: 5px;-webkit-border-radius: 5px;border-radius: 5px; width:100px;background-color: #EEEEEE;background-color: rgba(238, 238, 238, 0.6);filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.gradient(startColorStr='#99EEEEEE',EndColorStr='#99EEEEEE');text-align:center;padding:5px;position:fixed;bottom:10px;right:10px;cursor:pointer;color:#444;text-decoration:none;border:1px solid #C9C9C9;}
</style>
<script type='text/javascript'>
    $(function() {
        $.fn.scrollToTop = function() {
            $(this).hide().removeAttr("href");
            if ($(window).scrollTop() != "0") {
                $(this).fadeIn("slow")
            }
            var scrollDiv = $(this);
            $(window).scroll(function() {
                if ($(window).scrollTop() == "0") {
                    $(scrollDiv).fadeOut("slow")
                } else {
                    $(scrollDiv).fadeIn("slow")
                }
            });
            $(this).click(function() {
                $("html, body").animate({
                    scrollTop: 0
                }, "slow")
            })
        }
    });
    $(function() {
        $("#w2b-StoTop").scrollToTop();
    });
</script>

    <div class="row global-header">
				<div class="wrap clearfix">	
			<div class="header-container column8" id="global-header-controls">
				<a href="http://www.cam.ac.uk" class="main-logo">
					<img alt="University of Cambridge"  src="/images/interface/main-logo-small.png" />
				</a>

				<ul class="unstyled-list horizontal-navigation global-navigation clearfix">
					<li><a  href="#study-with-us" >Study at Cambridge</a></li>

		<div class="row content recessed-content">
			<div class="wrap clearfix">
				<div class="column9  main-content" id="content">
					<div class="content-container">
                    <!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="PageTitle" -->
						<h1 style="display:inline;">American Literature Research Seminar</h1>
                        <!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
	<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="content" -->
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p align="center"><img border="0" src="AmLitG2.jpg" width="231" height="146" alt="Satellite picture of USA from space" /></p>
<p align="center"><strong>Michaelmas Term 2017</strong></p>
<p align="center">&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>12 October</strong> 4.30-6.00	SR24
(in collaboration with Twentieth Century seminar) </p>
<p>Prof Joy Porter (University of Hull) “The Native American Indian Poet of the First World War: Trauma, Modernity and the Bloomsbury/Garsington Set”.  </p>
<p><strong>26 October</strong> 4.30-6.00	SR24
  Prof David Trotter (University of Cambridge), “From Kitty Hawk to Cybernetics: 
  technique and technology in the literature of flight” </p>
<p><strong>29 November</strong> 4.30-6.00	G-R05	
  Prof Joseph Tabbi (University of Illinois, Chicago), title to be announced. </p>
<p><a href="Past-programmes.htm">Previous Programmes</a> </strong></p>
</p>
<hr />
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<!-- InstanceEndEditable -->

						
				  </div> <!-- end content container -->
				</div> <!-- end column9 maincontent -->
				<div class="column3 secondary-content">
				  <div class="content-container">
				    <div class="heading-container">
					<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="RelatedLinksTitle" -->							
                       <h2>Graduate Seminars</h2>
					   <!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
				    </div><!-- end heading container -->
					  
                      <!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="RelatedLinks" -->

<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="BackToStart" -->
<!-- This can be deleted if it isn't needed -->
<style type="text/css">
#w2b-StoTop {-moz-border-radius: 5px;-webkit-border-radius: 5px;border-radius: 5px; width:100px;background-color: #EEEEEE;background-color: rgba(238, 238, 238, 0.6);filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.gradient(startColorStr='#99EEEEEE',EndColorStr='#99EEEEEE');text-align:center;padding:5px;position:fixed;bottom:10px;right:10px;cursor:pointer;color:#444;text-decoration:none;border:1px solid #C9C9C9;}
</style>
<script type='text/javascript'>
    $(function() {
        $.fn.scrollToTop = function() {
            $(this).hide().removeAttr("href");
            if ($(window).scrollTop() != "0") {
                $(this).fadeIn("slow")
            }
            var scrollDiv = $(this);
            $(window).scroll(function() {
                if ($(window).scrollTop() == "0") {
                    $(scrollDiv).fadeOut("slow")
                } else {
                    $(scrollDiv).fadeIn("slow")
                }
            });
            $(this).click(function() {
                $("html, body").animate({
                    scrollTop: 0
                }, "slow")
            })
        }
    });
    $(function() {
        $("#w2b-StoTop").scrollToTop();
    });
</script>

		<div class="wrap clearfix page-sub-title recessed-sub-title">
			<div class="column12">
				<div class="content-container">
				<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="SectionTitle" -->
                	<p class="sub-title">Graduate Research Seminars</p>
				<!-- InstanceEndEditable -->

		<div class="row content recessed-content">
			<div class="wrap clearfix">
				<div class="column9  main-content" id="content">
					<div class="content-container">
                    <!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="PageTitle" -->
						<h1></h1>
                        <!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
	<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="content" -->
    <br clear="all" />
<hr class="teaser-divider" />
<br clear="all" />

<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding">	                
	    <div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img">
			<a href="/seminars/amlit/index.htm" class="teaser-img-link">
			<img class="scale-with-grid" src="images/american.jpg" alt="American Literature" /></a>
		</div>
		<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
			<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="/seminars/amlit/index.htm">American</a></h3>
			<p>A series of reading groups, discussions and academic papers organised by graduate students of American Literature. All welcome.</p>
			<a class="primary-cta" href="amlit/index.htm">Read more</a>
            <br />&nbsp;
		
		</div>
	</div>
</div>

<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding">
		<div class="teaser vertical-teaser">
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img">
   				<a href="rom.htm" class="teaser-img-link">
				<img class="scale-with-grid" src="images/eighteenth.jpg" alt="Eighteenth-Century and Romantic Studies" /></a>
			</div>
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
				<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="rom.htm">18th Century and Romatic Literature</a></h3>
				<p>The Eighteenth-Century and Romantic Studies Seminar is a research forum for those interested in the literature and culture of the period 1660 to 1830. It welcomes graduate students and teaching and research staff both from around Cambridge University (be that the English Faculty or other departments) and from beyond. Students and academics of all kinds, from postdoctoral researchers to professors, present papers for round-table discussion over drinks.</p>
				<a class="primary-cta" href="rom.htm">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;
			</div>
        </div>
	</div>
</div>

<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding sub-column-left-border">
		<div class="teaser vertical-teaser">      
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img">
				<a href="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/cmt/?cat=6" class="teaser-img-link">
                <img class="scale-with-grid" src="images/material-texts.jpg" alt="The History of Material Texts" /></a>
			</div>
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
				<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/cmt/?cat=6">The History of Material Texts</a></h3>
				<p>The seminar in the history of material texts is a forum for research across disciplines and across periods, for all those interested in the history of the book, bibliography, histories and theories of reading, and the intersections between intellectual history and material culture, including the creation, production, publication, distribution, reception, transmission, editing and subsequent history of texts as material objects in manuscript, print, digital media or other forms.</p>         
				<a class="primary-cta" href="http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/cmt/?cat=6">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;
			</div>	                
		</div>
	</div>
</div>


<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding sub-column-left-border">
    	<div class="teaser vertical-teaser">
	        
			      
		</div>
	</div>
</div>

<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding sub-column-left-border">

	        <div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img"></div>
			       
		</div>
	</div>

			</div>
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
				<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="med.htm">Medieval</a></h3>
				<p>&nbsp;</p>
				<a class="primary-cta" href="med.htm">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;

<div class="column4">

				<a href="nineteenth.htm" class="teaser-img-link">
				<img class="scale-with-grid" src="images/nineteenth.jpg" alt="Nineteenth Century" /></a>
			</div>
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
				<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="nineteenth.htm">Nineteenth Century</a></h3>
				<p>&nbsp;</p>
				<a class="primary-cta" href="nineteenth.htm">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;
			</div>	              
		</div>
	</div>
</div>

<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding sub-column-left-border">
		<div class="teaser vertical-teaser">      
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img"><img class="scale-with-grid" src="images/material-texts.jpg" alt="The History of Material Texts" /></div>
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
				<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="https://www.hist.cam.ac.uk/seminars/early-modern-interdisciplinary">Interdisciplinary Early Modern Graduate Seminar</a></h3>
				<p>&nbsp;</p>
				<a class="primary-cta" href="https://www.hist.cam.ac.uk/seminars/early-modern-interdisciplinary">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;
			</div>	       
		</div>
	</div>
</div>

&nbsp;<br />
<br clear="all" />
<hr class="teaser-divider" />
<br clear="all" />

<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding sub-column-left-border">
		<div class="teaser vertical-teaser">      
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img">
				<a href="queercultures.html" class="teaser-img-link">
				<img class="scale-with-grid" src="images/queercultures.jpg" alt="Queer Cultures Seminar" /></a>
			</div>
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
				<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="queercultures.html">Queer Cultures</a></h3>
				<p>Broadly historicist in approach, the Queer Cultures Research Seminar is intended to complement the recently established Cambridge Queer Theory Reading Group, providing an interdisciplinary forum for discussion between visiting academics, faculty members and graduate students across the arts and humanities. The seminar is dedicated to broadening the remit of contemporary queer studies, aiming to attract those interested in sexuality and gender studies, but also those with a particular interest in deviant, covert and  criminal cultures, in the aesthetics of transgression, in illicit discourses, and, more broadly, in what Christopher Isherwood once termed ‘the market value of the Odd.’</p>
				<a class="primary-cta" href="queercultures.html">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;
			</div>	              
		</div>
	</div>
</div>

<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding sub-column-left-border">
		<div class="teaser vertical-teaser">      
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img">
				<a href="./rgs/" class="teaser-img-link">
				<img class="scale-with-grid" src="../research/images/research-groups/renaissance.jpg" alt="Renaissance Research Group" /></a>
			</div>
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
				<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="./rgs/">Renaissance</a></h3>
				<p>&nbsp;</p>
				<a class="primary-cta" href="./rgs/">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;
			</div>	       
		</div>
	</div>
</div>
<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding">

				<a href="http://www.mml.cam.ac.uk/film/research/seminars" class="teaser-img-link">
				<img class="scale-with-grid" src="images/screen-media.jpg" alt="Screen Media" /></a>
			</div>
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
				<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="http://www.mml.cam.ac.uk/film/research/seminars">Screen Media</a></h3>
				<p>&nbsp;</p>
				<a class="primary-cta" href="http://www.mml.cam.ac.uk/film/research/seminars">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;
			</div>	    
        </div>
	</div>
</div>

&nbsp;<br />

<hr class="teaser-divider" />
<br clear="all" />



<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding sub-column-left-border">
		<div class="teaser vertical-teaser">      
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img">
				<a href="./song/" class="teaser-img-link">
				<img class="scale-with-grid" src="images/song-soundwavesquare.jpg" alt="Song Seminar" /></a>
			</div>
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
				<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="./song/">Song Seminar</a></h3>
				<p>Our regular lunchtime seminar fosters cross-disciplinary conversations about songs – their forms, functions, relations, histories – and about the poets, composers, songwriters, and performers who make them. We consider songs of all periods and traditions, and try to feature live performances when we can. </p>
				<a class="primary-cta" href="./song/">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;
			</div>	       
		</div>
	</div>
</div>

<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding sub-column-left-border">
		<div class="teaser vertical-teaser">      
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img">
				<a href="TheoryCC.htm" class="teaser-img-link">
				<img class="scale-with-grid" src="images/lit-theory.jpg" alt="Theory, Criticism, and Culture" /></a>
			</div>
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
				<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="TheoryCC.htm">Theory, Criticism, and Culture</a></h3>
				<p>&nbsp;</p>
				<a class="primary-cta" href="TheoryCC.htm">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;
			</div>
		</div>
	</div>
</div>

<div class="column4">
	<div class="content-container side-padding">
		<div class="teaser vertical-teaser">
		<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-img">
				<a href="twentieth.htm" class="teaser-img-link">
				<img class="scale-with-grid" src="images/twentieth.jpg" alt="Twentieth Century and Contemporary Literature" /></a>
			</div>
			<div class="content-container vertical-teaser-txt">
				<h3 class="teaser-title"><a href="twentieth.htm">Twentieth Century and Contemporary Literature</a></h3>
				<p>The Twentieth Century and Contemporary Graduate Seminar is a forum for scholars to present research on aspects of literature and culture in this century and last. While the seminar serves as a testing ground for new ideas that push against the expectations of period and discipline, it is also home to our lively community of postgraduate and postdoctoral researchers, providing a valuable resource within the Faculty. </p>
				<a class="primary-cta" href="twentieth.htm">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;
			</div>	    
        </div>
	</div>
</div>

								<a class="primary-cta" href="parl.htm">Read more</a>
                <br />&nbsp;
			</div>

#w2b-StoTop {-moz-border-radius: 5px;-webkit-border-radius: 5px;border-radius: 5px; width:100px;background-color: #EEEEEE;background-color: rgba(238, 238, 238, 0.6);filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.gradient(startColorStr='#99EEEEEE',EndColorStr='#99EEEEEE');text-align:center;padding:5px;position:fixed;bottom:10px;right:10px;cursor:pointer;color:#444;text-decoration:none;border:1px solid #C9C9C9;}
</style>
<script type='text/javascript'>
    $(function() {
        $.fn.scrollToTop = function() {
            $(this).hide().removeAttr("href");
            if ($(window).scrollTop() != "0") {
                $(this).fadeIn("slow")
            }
            var scrollDiv = $(this);
            $(window).scroll(function() {
                if ($(window).scrollTop() == "0") {
                    $(scrollDiv).fadeOut("slow")
                } else {
                    $(scrollDiv).fadeIn("slow")
                }
            });
            $(this).click(function() {
                $("html, body").animate({
                    scrollTop: 0
                }, "slow")
            })
        }
    });
    $(function() {
        $("#w2b-StoTop").scrollToTop();
    });
</script>

		<div class="row content recessed-content">
			<div class="wrap clearfix">
				<div class="column9  main-content" id="content">
					<div class="content-container">
                    <!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="PageTitle" -->
					<h1 style="display:inline;">Medieval Graduate Seminar</h1>
                        <!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
	<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="content" -->
<p><strong>Michaelmas 2017</strong></p>
<p>These advanced research talks, followed by discussion, are aimed at graduate students, senior members and visiting scholars.
  Moodle Link:	Online viewers click here (Access restricted to registered users only) </p>
<p>Convenor: Prof. N Zeeman, Dr P Knox</p>
<p>Venue: S-R24, Faculty of English</p>
<p>This Michaelmas we will meet on Wednesdays as usual in SR 24 at the English Faculty, 9 West Road for the Medieval Graduate Seminar.
However, please note we are meeting *at a slightly different time*, 5.30pm. Papers begin promptly at 5.30, followed by questions. However,
biscuits will be available in SR 24 from 5.00p.m., so please bring along a mug of tea and catch up with fellow medievalists. After the
paper all are welcome to join the speaker for dinner in a nearby restaurant. For any enquiries beforehand, please contact Phil Knox
(pk453) or Nicky Zeeman (nz202). </p>
<p>Seminars:	
<p><strong>11 October</strong>: Professor Francesca Southerden (Oxford University), 'Two Adams: On Dante and Petrarch’s views of language in the beginning'
  
  <p>This paper will offer a comparative analysis of Dante's account of Adam's primiloquium, included in Book I of his De vulgari eloquentia,
    and Petrarch's life of Adam, which opens his De viris illustribus. Both texts constitute an interpretation and rewriting of the
    foundational linguistic narrative of Genesis, with a focus on the primordial bond between love and speech established at the time of the
    first human utterance and the forms of subjectivity and desire that are shaped through it.* Whereas the Adam of Dante's De vulgari
    eloquentia inaugurates vernacular speech with a cry of joy to God, that is an expression of pure gaudium and a gesture of reciprocal love
    between creature and Creator, Petrarch's Adam is depicted in mute surrender to the fleshly and seductive power of Eve's voice, elusively
    cast as a 'femineum murmur' which precipitates Adam's Fall. This paper will explore the different paradigms of vernacular language Dante and
    Petrarch's interpretations of the first speech act imply and how they relate to each author's understanding of metaphysics and desire.
    
    <p><strong>25 October</strong>: Daniel Reeve, Institute of Cultural Inquiry, Berlin
      
    'Form and Temporality in Sir Gawain and the Green Knight and Pearl’
    <p>This paper reconsiders structures of repetition and return in two works by the anonymous Gawain-poet, bringing them into dialogue with a set of philosophical and theological contexts which shed light onto these texts’ understanding and manipulation of various kinds of time. 
    <p><strong>8th November</strong>: Jon Whitman, Hebrew University of Jerusalem
        
        
        
    <!-- InstanceEndEditable -->

						
				  </div> <!-- end content container -->
				</div> <!-- end column9 maincontent -->

<style type="text/css">
#w2b-StoTop {-moz-border-radius: 5px;-webkit-border-radius: 5px;border-radius: 5px; width:100px;background-color: #EEEEEE;background-color: rgba(238, 238, 238, 0.6);filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.gradient(startColorStr='#99EEEEEE',EndColorStr='#99EEEEEE');text-align:center;padding:5px;position:fixed;bottom:10px;right:10px;cursor:pointer;color:#444;text-decoration:none;border:1px solid #C9C9C9;}
</style>
<script type='text/javascript'>
    $(function() {
        $.fn.scrollToTop = function() {
            $(this).hide().removeAttr("href");
            if ($(window).scrollTop() != "0") {
                $(this).fadeIn("slow")
            }
            var scrollDiv = $(this);
            $(window).scroll(function() {
                if ($(window).scrollTop() == "0") {
                    $(scrollDiv).fadeOut("slow")
                } else {
                    $(scrollDiv).fadeIn("slow")
                }
            });
            $(this).click(function() {
                $("html, body").animate({
                    scrollTop: 0
                }, "slow")
            })
        }
    });
    $(function() {
        $("#w2b-StoTop").scrollToTop();
    });
</script>

				<div class="column9  main-content" id="content">
					<div class="content-container">
                    <!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="PageTitle" -->
						<h1 style="display:inline;">Nineteenth-Century </h1>
                        <!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
	<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="content" -->
<p><strong>Michaelmas Term 2017</strong></p>
<p>Tuesday 5-6.30pm in S-R24 Faculty of English</p>
<p><strong>10 October</strong><br/>	
  Prof. John Gardner (ARU)	Birkbeck, <br/>The Glasgow Frankenstein and the First Mechanics Institutes</p>
<p><strong>24 October </strong><br/>
  Dr Gregory Tate (University of St Andrews)<br/>	Wordsworth, Humphry Davy, and the Forms of Nature</p>
  </p>
<p><strong>7 November</strong><br/>	Dr Mathelinda Nabugodi (Newcastle University)<br/>	Echoes of translation in Percy Bysshe Shelley's late work
  </p>
  </p>
</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
    </p>
    <!-- InstanceEndEditable -->

						<li><a href="http://www.cam.ac.uk/research/news">News</a></li>

						<li><a href="http://www.cam.ac.uk/research/discussion">Discussion</a></li>
						<li><a href="http://www.cam.ac.uk/research/spotlight-on">Spotlight on...</a></li>
						<li><a href="http://www.cam.ac.uk/research/research-at-cambridge">About research at Cambridge</a></li>
					</ul>
				</div>
			</div>
		</div>	</div>

</style>
<script type='text/javascript'>
    $(function() {
        $.fn.scrollToTop = function() {
            $(this).hide().removeAttr("href");
            if ($(window).scrollTop() != "0") {
                $(this).fadeIn("slow")
            }
            var scrollDiv = $(this);
            $(window).scroll(function() {
                if ($(window).scrollTop() == "0") {
                    $(scrollDiv).fadeOut("slow")
                } else {
                    $(scrollDiv).fadeIn("slow")
                }
            });
            $(this).click(function() {
                $("html, body").animate({
                    scrollTop: 0
                }, "slow")
            })
        }
    });
    $(function() {
        $("#w2b-StoTop").scrollToTop();
    });
</script>

		<div class="wrap clearfix page-sub-title recessed-sub-title">
			<div class="column12">
				<div class="content-container">
				<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="SectionTitle" -->
                	<p class="sub-title">Graduate Seminars</p>
				<!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
   				</div>
			</div>
		</div>
	</div>


		<div class="row content recessed-content">
			<div class="wrap clearfix">
				<div class="column9  main-content" id="content">
					<div class="content-container">
                    <!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="PageTitle" -->
						<h1 style="display:inline;">Queer Cultures Seminar</h1>
                        <!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
	<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="content" -->
<p>Broadly historicist in approach, the seminar is intended to provide an interdisciplinary forum for discussion between visiting academics, faculty members across the arts and humanities, and graduate students.

The sessions endeavor to broaden the remit of contemporary Queer Studies, aiming to attract those interested in sexuality and gender studies, but also those with a particular interest in deviant, covert and criminal cultures, in the aesthetics of transgression, in illicit discourses, and, more broadly, in what Christopher Isherwood once termed ‘the market value of the Odd.’

</p>
<p>Wednesdays 4.30pm-6.00pm, English Faculty Boardroom, followed by drinks and dinner.
  
  All welcome.  </p>
<p><strong>1 November</strong> - Rob Eagle (UWE), 
Sixty Nine Club: Filming British Gay Leather 
 History</p>
<p><strong>15 November</strong> - Dr Meg John Barker (Open University), 'Non-Binary Gender So 
 Far'</p>
<p><strong>29 November</strong> -Dr Catherine Silverstone (QMUL), 'Queer Legacies: Death,
 Memory and Performance' </p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>

	<!-- InstanceEndEditable -->

						
				  </div> <!-- end content container -->
				</div> <!-- end column9 maincontent -->
				<div class="column3 secondary-content">
				  <div class="content-container">
				    <div class="heading-container">
					<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="RelatedLinksTitle" -->							
                       <h2>Related Links</h2>
					   <!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
				    </div><!-- end heading container -->
					  
                      <!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="RelatedLinks" -->

    <li>Other Research Groups</li>
		<ul style="margin-left:1em; text-indent:hanging;">
  			<li style="padding:0;"><a href="http://www.marginalia.co.uk/">The Medieval Reading Group</a> <img src="/images/interface/icon-external-link.png" width="9" height="9" /></li>
  		</ul>
    </li>
  <li><a href="/research/features/index.htm">Research Features</a></li>
    <li><a href="/research/intranet/index.htm">Research Funding</a> <span style="font-size:80%;">(Raven Needed)</span></li>
    <li><a href="/research/intranet/access.htm">Open Access</a> <span style="font-size:80%;">(Raven Needed)</span></li>
    <li><a href="/research/intranet/impact/">Research Impact</a> <span style="font-size:80%;">(Raven Needed)</span></li>
</ul>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
                      <!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
	
					</div> <!-- end content container -->
					<div class="content-container"><!--Promo Container would go here --></div>
				</div> <!-- end column3 -->
			</div>	<!-- end wrap -->
		</div> <!-- end row -->

<style type="text/css">
#w2b-StoTop {-moz-border-radius: 5px;-webkit-border-radius: 5px;border-radius: 5px; width:100px;background-color: #EEEEEE;background-color: rgba(238, 238, 238, 0.6);filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.gradient(startColorStr='#99EEEEEE',EndColorStr='#99EEEEEE');text-align:center;padding:5px;position:fixed;bottom:10px;right:10px;cursor:pointer;color:#444;text-decoration:none;border:1px solid #C9C9C9;}
</style>
<script type='text/javascript'>
    $(function() {
        $.fn.scrollToTop = function() {
            $(this).hide().removeAttr("href");
            if ($(window).scrollTop() != "0") {
                $(this).fadeIn("slow")
            }
            var scrollDiv = $(this);
            $(window).scroll(function() {
                if ($(window).scrollTop() == "0") {
                    $(scrollDiv).fadeOut("slow")
                } else {
                    $(scrollDiv).fadeIn("slow")
                }
            });
            $(this).click(function() {
                $("html, body").animate({
                    scrollTop: 0
                }, "slow")
            })
        }
    });
    $(function() {
        $("#w2b-StoTop").scrollToTop();
    });
</script>
<a href='#' id='w2b-StoTop' style='display:none;'>Scroll to start<br />of page.</a><!-- InstanceEndEditable -->

		<li><a href="https://www.english.cam.ac.uk/computing/">Faculty Computing</a></li>
	</ul>
</li>

		<div class="row content recessed-content">

				<div class="column9  main-content" id="content">
					<div class="content-container">
                    <!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="PageTitle" -->
                    <img src="rgs.gif" alt="Renaissance Graduate Seminar" class="scale-with-grid">

	<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="content" -->

<p></p>
<h2><b>PROGRAMME 2017-2018</b></h2>
<p><em>All 
Senior Members, Graduate Students, and Academic Visitors Welcome</em></p>
<h3>&nbsp;</h3>
<h3> Michaelmas Term 2017</h3>
<p>5.15pm in G-R04, Faculty of English</p>
  <p>Tuesday, 17 October     <br/>
    <strong>Andrew Hadfield</strong> (Sussex)<br/> 
    ‘Lying, testimony, and murder in early modern England: the case of Annis and George Dell (1606)’</p>
  

 

  <p>Tuesday, 31 October <br/>
    <strong>Kylie Murray</strong> (Cambridge)<br/> ‘Elizabeth Melville and the poetics of desire in early modern Britain’</p>
    </p>
  <p>Tuesday, 14 November<br/>            
    <strong>Jason Scott-Warren</strong> (Cambridge)<br/> ‘Distributing Donne’</p>
  </p>
  <h2><b>PAST PROGRAMMES</b></h2>
<h3> Easter Term 2017</h3>

<p>5.15pm in G-R06/07 </p>
<p>Tuesday, 09/05/17<br/>
  <strong>Julie Sanders</strong> (Newcastle)<br/>
'Fire, flood, ice and inundation: environmental event and narrative description in the early modern period'
<p>Tuesday, 23/05/17<br/>
  <strong>Hero Chalmers </strong>(Cambridge)<br/>
'Rhetoric and Restoration in Margaret Cavendish's Orations of Divers Sorts (1662)'

<h3>Lent Term 2017</h3>
<p>5.15pm in G-R06-07 </p>
<p>Tuesday, 31/01/17<br/>J<strong>ohn Gillies</strong> (Essex)<br/>
The conversational turn in Shakespeare 

<p>Tuesday, 14/02/17 - <strong>CANCELLED</strong><br/><strong>Kylie Murray</strong> (Cambridge)<br/>
  Elizabeth Melville, Lady Culross (c.1578-c.1640)
  and the poetics of desire in early modern Britain
  
<p>Tuesday, 28/02/17<br/>
  <strong>David Hillman</strong> (Cambridge)<br/>
  Farewell as welcome (and vice versa) in Antony
  and Cleopatra
<h3> Michaelmas Term 2016</h3>
  <p>5.15pm in G-R06-07</p>
  <p>Tuesday, 18/10/16<br/>
    <strong>Sue Wiseman</strong> (Birkbeck) <br/>	
    ‘Wheatcroft’s Written World’
  <p>Tuesday, 01/11/16<br/>
    <strong>Andy Kesson</strong> (Roehampton) <br/>‘Peculiar houses: building public theatres in Elizabethan London’
    <p>Tuesday, 15/11/16	<br/>
      <strong>Jonathan Sawday</strong> (Saint Louis)<br/>	 
    'Bermudas or Bahamas? Andrew Marvell and the Eleutherian Republic’<h2>

<h3><strong>Easter Term 2015</strong></h3>
  <p>06/05/15<br/>
 Dr Regina Schwartz, Northwestern University</p>
  Tuesday, 26/05/2015<br/>
  "The other syde of the lefe": textual surfaces in early modern England<br/>
  <strong>Dr Lucy Razzall</strong><br/>
University of Cambridge
  <h3><strong>Lent Term 2015</strong></h3>
  <p>27/01/15 <br/>
  The normality of the poet, Gascoigne to
    Jonson<br/>
    <strong>Michael Hetherington</strong><br/>
  Cambridge</p>
  <p>    10/02/15<br/> Radical politics and the theology of
    Milton's Masque<br/>
    <strong>Debora Shuger</strong><br/>
  UCLA</p>
  <p>
    24/02/15 <br/>Shakespeare&rsquo;s voice <br/>
    <strong>David Schalkwyk </strong><br/>
  QMUL</p>
  <p>
    10/03/15 <br/>Childbirth Poetics in Milton and Pulter<br/> 
    <strong>Ruth Connolly</strong><br/>
    Newcastle
  </p>
  <h3><strong>Michaelmas Term 2014</strong></h3>
  <p>21/10/14<br/>
    'Epics, objects, and interruptions'
<br/>
<strong>Jane Grogan</strong> (University College, Dublin) </p>
  <p>04/11/14<br/>
  &lsquo;&ldquo;Places in the Court&rdquo;: Gender, Rank and Service in <em>The Duchess of Malfi&rsquo;</em><br/>
  <strong>Michael    Neill</strong> (Auckland)</p>
  <p>18/11/14<br/>
  &lsquo;Sir Philip Sidney&rsquo;s Treatise of Horsemanship&rsquo;<br/>
  <strong>Micha    Lazarus</strong> (Cambridge)</p>
<p>02/12/14<br/>
  'Restful forms: verse form and memory in the lyric poetry of Wyatt and Surrey'<br/>
  <strong>Chris Stamatakis</strong> (University College, London)</p>
  <h3>&nbsp;</h3>
  <h3><strong>Easter Term 2014</strong></h3>
  <p>6 May 2014<br/>
    'Performing    Children in Renaissance England'<br/>
    <strong>Bart    van Es</strong> (Oxford)</p>
  <p>20 May 2014<br/>
    'Imitatio and Style    in the Sixteenth Century'<br/>
    <strong>Colin    Burrow</strong> (Oxford)
  
  <h3>&nbsp;</h3>
  <h3><strong>Lent Term 2014</strong></h3>
  <p>28 January 2014<br/>
    All is (Not) True:    Cymbeline&rsquo;s Much Ado about Nothing, Noting, (K)not Knowing, and    Counterfeiting<br/>
    <strong>Patricia Parker</strong> (Stanford)
  <p>11 February 2014<br/>
    'Hail muse,    etcetera!' <br/>
    <strong>Laurie Maguire</strong> (Oxford)<br/>
  <p>25 February 2014<br/>
    'When critics were    scholars: literature and the humanities from the King James Bible to the    &quot;Battle of the Books&quot;' <br/>
    <strong>Nick Hardy</strong> (Cambridge)<br/>
  <p>11 March 2014<br/>
    'Editing    as &quot;amends-making&quot;: James Cancellar and Elizabeth I's <em>Godly    Meditation of the Soule</em>'.&nbsp; <br/>
    <strong>Oliver Wort</strong> (Cambridge)  
<h3>&nbsp;</h3>
  <h3><strong>Michaelmas Term 2013</strong></h3>
  <p>15 October<br />
  &lsquo;Sermons, Plays and Note-Takers: Hamlet Q1 as a *Noted*    Text&rsquo; <br/>
    <strong>Tiffany Stern</strong> (Oxford)</p>
  <p>22 October<br/>
    &lsquo;Skill, Style, and Freedom&rsquo; <br/>
    <strong>Jeff Dolven</strong> (Princeton) </p>
  <p>12 November<br/>
    Binding Language in <em>Measure for    Measure</em><br/>
    <strong>John Kerrigan</strong> (Cambridge)</p>
  <p>26 November&lsquo;<br/>
    Embodying Song in Early Modern England&rsquo;<br/>
    <strong>Katie Larson</strong> (Toronto) </p>

<hr />
<p><strong> for further information please contact Hester Lees-Jeffries (<a href="mailto:hmml2@cam.ac.uk">hmml2@cam.ac.uk</a>) </strong></p>
<p>
<strong> Seminar Convenors: </strong>Gavin Alexander,  John Kerrigan, Hester Lees-Jeffries, Raphael Lyne, Subha Mukherji, Sophie Read, Jason Scott-Warren, Chris Tilmouth</p>
<p><a href="past.htm">PAST PROGRAMMES</a></p>

#w2b-StoTop {-moz-border-radius: 5px;-webkit-border-radius: 5px;border-radius: 5px; width:100px;background-color: #EEEEEE;background-color: rgba(238, 238, 238, 0.6);filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.gradient(startColorStr='#99EEEEEE',EndColorStr='#99EEEEEE');text-align:center;padding:5px;position:fixed;bottom:10px;right:10px;cursor:pointer;color:#444;text-decoration:none;border:1px solid #C9C9C9;}
</style>
<script type='text/javascript'>
    $(function() {
        $.fn.scrollToTop = function() {
            $(this).hide().removeAttr("href");
            if ($(window).scrollTop() != "0") {
                $(this).fadeIn("slow")
            }
            var scrollDiv = $(this);
            $(window).scroll(function() {
                if ($(window).scrollTop() == "0") {
                    $(scrollDiv).fadeOut("slow")
                } else {
                    $(scrollDiv).fadeIn("slow")
                }
            });
            $(this).click(function() {
                $("html, body").animate({
                    scrollTop: 0
                }, "slow")
            })
        }
    });
    $(function() {
        $("#w2b-StoTop").scrollToTop();
    });
</script>

		<div class="row content recessed-content">

				<div class="column9  main-content" id="content">
					<div class="content-container">
                    <!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="PageTitle" -->
                    <img src="rgs.gif" alt="Renaissance Graduate Seminar" class="scale-with-grid">
                        <!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
	<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="content" -->

<p></p>
<h2><b>PROGRAMME 2017-2018</b></h2>
<p><em>All 
Senior Members, Graduate Students, and Academic Visitors Welcome</em></p>
<h3>&nbsp;</h3>
<h3> Michaelmas Term 2017</h3>
<p>5.15pm in G-R04, Faculty of English</p>
  <p>Tuesday, 17 October     <br/>
    <strong>Andrew Hadfield</strong> (Sussex)<br/> 
    ‘Lying, testimony, and murder in early modern England: the case of Annis and George Dell (1606)’</p>
  

 

  <p>Tuesday, 31 October <br/>
    <strong>Kylie Murray</strong> (Cambridge)<br/> ‘Elizabeth Melville and the poetics of desire in early modern Britain’</p>
    </p>
  <p>Tuesday, 14 November<br/>            
    <strong>Jason Scott-Warren</strong> (Cambridge)<br/> ‘Distributing Donne’</p>
  </p>
  <h2><b>PAST PROGRAMMES</b></h2>
<h3> Easter Term 2017</h3>

<p>5.15pm in G-R06/07 </p>
<p>Tuesday, 09/05/17<br/>
  <strong>Julie Sanders</strong> (Newcastle)<br/>
'Fire, flood, ice and inundation: environmental event and narrative description in the early modern period'
<p>Tuesday, 23/05/17<br/>
  <strong>Hero Chalmers </strong>(Cambridge)<br/>
'Rhetoric and Restoration in Margaret Cavendish's Orations of Divers Sorts (1662)'

<h3>Lent Term 2017</h3>
<p>5.15pm in G-R06-07 </p>
<p>Tuesday, 31/01/17<br/>J<strong>ohn Gillies</strong> (Essex)<br/>
The conversational turn in Shakespeare 

<p>Tuesday, 14/02/17 - <strong>CANCELLED</strong><br/><strong>Kylie Murray</strong> (Cambridge)<br/>
  Elizabeth Melville, Lady Culross (c.1578-c.1640)
  and the poetics of desire in early modern Britain
  
<p>Tuesday, 28/02/17<br/>
  <strong>David Hillman</strong> (Cambridge)<br/>
  Farewell as welcome (and vice versa) in Antony
  and Cleopatra
<h3> Michaelmas Term 2016</h3>
  <p>5.15pm in G-R06-07</p>
  <p>Tuesday, 18/10/16<br/>
    <strong>Sue Wiseman</strong> (Birkbeck) <br/>	
    ‘Wheatcroft’s Written World’
  <p>Tuesday, 01/11/16<br/>
    <strong>Andy Kesson</strong> (Roehampton) <br/>‘Peculiar houses: building public theatres in Elizabethan London’
    <p>Tuesday, 15/11/16	<br/>
      <strong>Jonathan Sawday</strong> (Saint Louis)<br/>	 
    'Bermudas or Bahamas? Andrew Marvell and the Eleutherian Republic’<h2>

<h3><strong>Easter Term 2015</strong></h3>
  <p>06/05/15<br/>
 Dr Regina Schwartz, Northwestern University</p>
  Tuesday, 26/05/2015<br/>
  "The other syde of the lefe": textual surfaces in early modern England<br/>
  <strong>Dr Lucy Razzall</strong><br/>
University of Cambridge
  <h3><strong>Lent Term 2015</strong></h3>
  <p>27/01/15 <br/>
  The normality of the poet, Gascoigne to
    Jonson<br/>
    <strong>Michael Hetherington</strong><br/>
  Cambridge</p>
  <p>    10/02/15<br/> Radical politics and the theology of
    Milton's Masque<br/>
    <strong>Debora Shuger</strong><br/>
  UCLA</p>
  <p>
    24/02/15 <br/>Shakespeare&rsquo;s voice <br/>
    <strong>David Schalkwyk </strong><br/>
  QMUL</p>
  <p>
    10/03/15 <br/>Childbirth Poetics in Milton and Pulter<br/> 
    <strong>Ruth Connolly</strong><br/>
    Newcastle
  </p>
  <h3><strong>Michaelmas Term 2014</strong></h3>
  <p>21/10/14<br/>
    'Epics, objects, and interruptions'
<br/>
<strong>Jane Grogan</strong> (University College, Dublin) </p>
  <p>04/11/14<br/>
  &lsquo;&ldquo;Places in the Court&rdquo;: Gender, Rank and Service in <em>The Duchess of Malfi&rsquo;</em><br/>
  <strong>Michael    Neill</strong> (Auckland)</p>
  <p>18/11/14<br/>
  &lsquo;Sir Philip Sidney&rsquo;s Treatise of Horsemanship&rsquo;<br/>
  <strong>Micha    Lazarus</strong> (Cambridge)</p>
<p>02/12/14<br/>
  'Restful forms: verse form and memory in the lyric poetry of Wyatt and Surrey'<br/>
  <strong>Chris Stamatakis</strong> (University College, London)</p>
  <h3>&nbsp;</h3>
  <h3><strong>Easter Term 2014</strong></h3>
  <p>6 May 2014<br/>
    'Performing    Children in Renaissance England'<br/>
    <strong>Bart    van Es</strong> (Oxford)</p>
  <p>20 May 2014<br/>
    'Imitatio and Style    in the Sixteenth Century'<br/>
    <strong>Colin    Burrow</strong> (Oxford)
  
  <h3>&nbsp;</h3>
  <h3><strong>Lent Term 2014</strong></h3>
  <p>28 January 2014<br/>
    All is (Not) True:    Cymbeline&rsquo;s Much Ado about Nothing, Noting, (K)not Knowing, and    Counterfeiting<br/>
    <strong>Patricia Parker</strong> (Stanford)
  <p>11 February 2014<br/>
    'Hail muse,    etcetera!' <br/>
    <strong>Laurie Maguire</strong> (Oxford)<br/>
  <p>25 February 2014<br/>
    'When critics were    scholars: literature and the humanities from the King James Bible to the    &quot;Battle of the Books&quot;' <br/>
    <strong>Nick Hardy</strong> (Cambridge)<br/>
  <p>11 March 2014<br/>
    'Editing    as &quot;amends-making&quot;: James Cancellar and Elizabeth I's <em>Godly    Meditation of the Soule</em>'.&nbsp; <br/>
    <strong>Oliver Wort</strong> (Cambridge)  
<h3>&nbsp;</h3>
  <h3><strong>Michaelmas Term 2013</strong></h3>
  <p>15 October<br />
  &lsquo;Sermons, Plays and Note-Takers: Hamlet Q1 as a *Noted*    Text&rsquo; <br/>
    <strong>Tiffany Stern</strong> (Oxford)</p>
  <p>22 October<br/>
    &lsquo;Skill, Style, and Freedom&rsquo; <br/>
    <strong>Jeff Dolven</strong> (Princeton) </p>
  <p>12 November<br/>
    Binding Language in <em>Measure for    Measure</em><br/>
    <strong>John Kerrigan</strong> (Cambridge)</p>
  <p>26 November&lsquo;<br/>
    Embodying Song in Early Modern England&rsquo;<br/>
    <strong>Katie Larson</strong> (Toronto) </p>

<hr />
<p><strong> for further information please contact Hester Lees-Jeffries (<a href="mailto:hmml2@cam.ac.uk">hmml2@cam.ac.uk</a>) </strong></p>
<p>
<strong> Seminar Convenors: </strong>Gavin Alexander,  John Kerrigan, Hester Lees-Jeffries, Raphael Lyne, Subha Mukherji, Sophie Read, Jason Scott-Warren, Chris Tilmouth</p>
<p><a href="past.htm">PAST PROGRAMMES</a></p>

							<li><a href="http://www.educ.cam.ac.uk">Courses in education</a></li>
						</ul>
					</div>
				</div>
			</div>
            
			<div class="column3 footer-navigation">
				<div class="content-container navigation-list">
					<h3><a href="http://www.cam.ac.uk/about-the-university">About the University</a></h3> 
					<ul class="unstyled-list page-children">

#w2b-StoTop {-moz-border-radius: 5px;-webkit-border-radius: 5px;border-radius: 5px; width:100px;background-color: #EEEEEE;background-color: rgba(238, 238, 238, 0.6);filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.gradient(startColorStr='#99EEEEEE',EndColorStr='#99EEEEEE');text-align:center;padding:5px;position:fixed;bottom:10px;right:10px;cursor:pointer;color:#444;text-decoration:none;border:1px solid #C9C9C9;}
</style>
<script type='text/javascript'>
    $(function() {
        $.fn.scrollToTop = function() {
            $(this).hide().removeAttr("href");
            if ($(window).scrollTop() != "0") {
                $(this).fadeIn("slow")
            }
            var scrollDiv = $(this);
            $(window).scroll(function() {
                if ($(window).scrollTop() == "0") {
                    $(scrollDiv).fadeOut("slow")
                } else {
                    $(scrollDiv).fadeIn("slow")
                }
            });
            $(this).click(function() {
                $("html, body").animate({
                    scrollTop: 0
                }, "slow")
            })
        }
    });
    $(function() {
        $("#w2b-StoTop").scrollToTop();
    });
</script>
